     namo namas te 'stu trilokapūjite ||21.16||     नमो नमस्ते ऽस्तु त्रिलोकपूजिते ॥२१:१६
namo namas te 'stu gadāgrapāṇaye नमो नमस्ते ऽस्तु गदाग्रपाणये
     namo namas te varacakrapāṇaye |     नमो नमस्ते वरचक्रपाणये ।
namo namas te 'stu ca śaṅkhapāṇaye नमो नमस्ते ऽस्तु च शङ्खपाणये
     namo namas te 'stu ca kambupāṇaye ||21.17||     नमो नमस्ते ऽस्तु च कम्बुपाणये ॥२१:१७
namo namas te 'stu jalaughaśāyine नमो नमस्ते ऽस्तु जलौघशायिने
18a jalaugha° C94C45E; jalogha° C02K82
     namo namas te haramardarūpiṇe |     नमो नमस्ते हरमर्दरूपिणे ।

namo namas te khagarājaketave नमो नमस्ते खगराजकेतवे

     namo namas te 'dbhutarūpadarśine |     नमो नमस्ते ऽद्भुतरूपदर्शिने ।
namo namas te 'yutasūryatejase नमो नमस्ते ऽयुतसूर्यतेजसे

namo namas te 'maralokasaṃstute नमो नमस्ते ऽमरलोकसंस्तुते

     namo namas te jagamaṇḍapāśraye |     नमो नमस्ते जगमण्डपाश्रये ।
20b namo namas te jagamaṇḍapāśraye C94C45E; ××××××××××śraye C02, omitted in K82
namo namas te jagadekavatsale नमो नमस्ते जगदेकवत्सले
20c jagadeka° C94C45K82E; jagadeka° C02 • °vatsale CK82; °vatsare E
     namo namas te śivasarvade namaḥ ||21.20||     नमो नमस्ते शिवसर्वदे नमः ॥२१:२०
20d Cf. Bṛhatkālottara (NGMPP B 29/59) f. 87a: jñāna 2 śabda 2 sūkṣma 2 śivasarvada oṃ namaḥ śivāya|
kṣamasva govinda mamāparādham क्षमस्व गोविन्द ममापराधम्
21a mamā° C94C45K82E; mama C02
     atīva pṛṣṭena durātmanena |     अतीव पृष्टेन दुरात्मनेन ।
21b °tmanena C94C02K82E; °tmane C45
mayeda sarvaṃ kathitaṃ smayena मयेद सर्वं कथितं स्मयेन
21c mayeda CK82; mayedaṃ E (unmetrical)
     dayāṃ kuru tvaṃ tridaśeśvareṇa ||21.21||     दयां कुरु त्वं त्रिदशेश्वरेण ॥२१:२१
21d °śeśvareṇa C94C02K82E; °śaiśvareṇa C45
vaiśampāyana uvāca | वैशम्पायन उवाच ।
stotreṇānena saṃtuṣṭaḥ keśavaḥ paravīrahā | स्तोत्रेणानेन संतुष्टः केशवः परवीरहा ।
22c keśavaḥ paravīrahā C94C45K82E; keśavaḥ paravīrahā C02 toplost
pratyuvāca mahāseno girayā nirupaspṛhā ||21.22|| प्रत्युवाच महासेनो गिरया निरुपस्पृहा ॥२१:२२
22c pratyuvāca C94C45K82E; pratyuvāca C02 toplost • mahāseno C45C02K82E; ma××× C94 22d girayā C94C45K82E; giriyā C02 • nirupa° CK82; nirūpa° E
stotreṇānena me tāta tuṣṭo 'smi bhṛśam ejitaḥ | स्तोत्रेणानेन मे तात तुष्टो ऽस्मि भृशमेजितः ।
23a me tāta C94C02E; mattāta C45, saṃtāta K82
durlabhāny api trailokye dadāmi varam īpsitam ||21.23|| दुर्लभान्यपि त्रैलोक्ये ददामि वरमीप्सितम् ॥२१:२३
23c trailokye C94C45K82E; trailokya C02
anena māṃ stauti nirāśritena अनेन मां स्तौति निराश्रितेन
24a stauti C94C45K82E; stoti C02
     tvayoktavedārthamanohareṇa |     त्वयोक्तवेदार्थमनोहरेण ।
yāvanti tatrākṣarasaṃkhyam asti यावन्ति तत्राक्षरसंख्यमस्ति
     tāvanti kalpān divi te vasanti ||21.24||     तावन्ति कल्पान्दिवि ते वसन्ति ॥२१:२४
24d kalpān C94K82; kalpaṃ C45E, kalpa C02
tvaṃ cāpi me brūhi varaṃ yatheṣṭaṃ त्वं चापि मे ब्रूहि वरं यथेष्टं
25a tvaṃ cāpi me brūhi C45C02K82E; tvañc××××hi C94
     trailokyarājyād api nirviśaṅkam |     त्रैलोक्यराज्यादपि निर्विशङ्कम् ।
25b °rājyā° CE; °rā° K82ac, °rājā° K82pc • °śaṅkam CK82; °śaṅka E
dadāmi kiṃ saptamahīśvaratvam ददामि किं सप्तमहीश्वरत्वम्
25c kiṃ C94C02K82E; ki C45 • °tvam C94C45K82E; °tvaṃm C02
     athārtharāśiṃ bahukanyakāṃ vā ||21.25||     अथार्थराशिं बहुकन्यकां वा ॥२१:२५
25d athārtharāśiṃ C94C45K82; athārtharāśi C02, athārthaṃ rāśīṃ E • °kanyakāṃ vā K82E; °kanyakā vā C94C02, °kanyakā×ā C45
śrutvaiva divyaṃ varam acyutasya श्रुत्वैव दिव्यं वरमच्युतस्य
26a śrutvaiva E; anarthayajña uvāca| śrutvaiva C94C45K82, vigatarāga uvāca| śrutvaiva C02
     praṇamya pādadvayapaṅkaje tu |     प्रणम्य पादद्वयपङ्कजे तु ।

vijñāya viṣṇuṃ varadaṃ vareṇyaṃ विज्ञाय विष्णुं वरदं वरेण्यं

     ? prahṛ cetaḥ pukāncito 'to 'bravīt ||21.26||     ? प्रहृ चेतः पुकान्चितो ऽतो ऽब्रवीत् ॥२१:२६
26d omitted in CK82
anarthayajña uvāca | अनर्थयज्ञ उवाच ।
27 anarthayajña uvāca E; omitted in CK82
na kāmaye 'nyapravaraṃ tu deva न कामये ऽन्यप्रवरं तु देव
27a 'nyapravaraṃ tu C94C02K82; nyaprabhavan tu C45, 'nyaṃ pravaraṃ tu E
     asaṃśayaṃ bandhanasāram ekam |     असंशयं बन्धनसारमेकम् ।
27b asaṃśayaṃ CK82; asaṃśaya E • °sāram ekam C45C02K82E; °sārame× C94

27c vimuktabandho C45C02K82E; ××××× C94 • prasādād CK82; pramādād E
     bhavāmi govinda rataś ca dharme ||21.27||     भवामि गोविन्द रतश्च धर्मे ॥२१:२७
27d rataś CK82; ratañ E
bhagavān uvāca | भगवानुवाच ।
yathaiva cittaṃ tava suprasannaṃ यथैव चित्तं तव सुप्रसन्नं
     maharṣi devair api naiva dṛṣṭam |     महर्षि देवैरपि नैव दृष्टम् ।
akalmaṣaṃ duḥkhavivarjitatvam अकल्मषं दुःखविवर्जितत्वम्
28c akalmaṣaṃ E; akalmaṣas tvaṃ C94K82 (unmetrical), akalmaṣatvaṃ C45 (unmetrical), akalmatvaṃ C02 (unmetrical) • duḥkha° C94pcC45C02K82E; duḥ° C94ac

gacchāma bho sāmprata śvetadvīpam गच्छाम भो साम्प्रत श्वेतद्वीपम्
29a gacchāma bho CK82; gacchāmato E • sāmprata CK82; samprati E

     ghorārṇave naiva punaś caranti ||21.29||     घोरार्णवे नैव पुनश्चरन्ति ॥२१:२९
vaiśampāyana uvāca | वैशम्पायन उवाच ।
30 vaiśampāyana uvāca C94E; omitted in C45C02K82ac, vaiśaṃ u K82pc
evam uktvā haris tatra kare gṛhya tapodhanam | एवमुक्त्वा हरिस्तत्र करे गृह्य तपोधनम् ।
30b gṛhya tapodhanam CE; ××××dhana K82
tataḥ so 'ntarhitas tatra tenaiva saha keśavaḥ ||21.30|| ततः सो ऽन्तर्हितस्तत्र तेनैव सह केशवः ॥२१:३०
30c so 'ntarhitas ta° C94C45; so ntarhitas ta° K82, te ntarhitās ta° C02, te karhitās ta° E 30d keśavaḥ CK82; keśava E
evaṃ hi dharmas tv adhikaprabhāvād एवं हि धर्मस्त्वधिकप्रभावाद्
31a adhika° C94C45K82; adhikaṃ C02E
     gataḥ sa lokaṃ puruṣottamasya |     गतः स लोकं पुरुषोत्तमस्य ।

     sanātanaṃ śāśvatam akṣarasya ||21.31||     सनातनं शाश्वतमक्षरस्य ॥२१:३१
31d sanātanaṃ E; sanātana C94 toplost C45C02K82 • °kṣarasya C45C02K82E; ××× C94
tvam eva bhaktiṃ kuru keśavasya त्वमेव भक्तिं कुरु केशवस्य
32a tvam eva C45C02K82E; ×m eva C94
     janārdanasyāmitavikramasya |     जनार्दनस्यामितविक्रमस्य ।
yathā hi tasyaiva dvijarṣabhasya यथा हि तस्यैव द्विजर्षभस्य
32c hi tasyaiva C94C45E; jitasyaiva C02, hi tasyava toplost K82
     gatiṃ labhasva puruṣottamasya ||21.32||     गतिं लभस्व पुरुषोत्तमस्य ॥२१:३२
kim anya bhūyaḥ kathayāmi rājan किमन्य भूयः कथयामि राजन्
33a kim anya bhū° C02E; kim anyad bhū° C94C45K82 (unmetrical)
     yad asti kautūhalam anyaśeṣam |     यदस्ति कौतूहलमन्यशेषम् ।
pṛcchasva māṃ tāta yathepsitaṃ te पृच्छस्व मां तात यथेप्सितं ते
     bhaviṣyabhūtaṃ bhavato yatheṣṭam ||21.33||     भविष्यभूतं भवतो यथेष्टम् ॥२१:३३
33d yatheṣṭam C94C45K82E; yatheṣṭa C02
janamejaya uvāca | जनमेजय उवाच ।
34 janamejaya uvāca CK82pcE; omitted in K82ac
kiyanti kalpāni gatāni pūrvam कियन्ति कल्पानि गतानि पूर्वम्
34a kiyanti CK82; kiyanta E
     bhaviṣyakalpāni kiyanti vipra |     भविष्यकल्पानि कियन्ति विप्र ।

34c °kalpaṃ C94C02K82E; °kalpa C45K82
     pravartamānād api kīrtayasva ||21.34||     प्रवर्तमानादपि कीर्तयस्व ॥२१:३४
vaiśampāyana uvāca | वैशम्पायन उवाच ।
35 vaiśampāyana C94C02K82E; veśanampāyana C45
parārdhakalpaṃ gata pūrva rājyam परार्धकल्पं गत पूर्व राज्यम्
     caturdaśaivendra narendra kalpam |     चतुर्दशैवेन्द्र नरेन्द्र कल्पम् ।
tathaiva manvantara kalpam ekam तथैव मन्वन्तर कल्पमेकम्
35c manvantarakalpam ekam CK82pc; manvarakalpam ekam K82ac, manvantaram ekakalpam E
     bhaviṣyakalpaṃ ca parārdham eva ||21.35||     भविष्यकल्पं च परार्धमेव ॥२१:३५
35d kalpaṃ ca parārdham eva C45C02K82E; ka××××××× C94

36a babhūva C94C02K82E; babhū C45
     gatāś ca manvantara ṣaṭ narendra |     गताश्च मन्वन्तर षट्नरेन्द्र ।
36b manvantaraṣaṭnarendra C94C45K82pc; manvaraṣaṭnarendra C02, manvantaṣaṭnarendra K82ac, manvantaraṣaṭnarendraḥ E
caturyugaṃ saptati ekayuktaṃ चतुर्युगं सप्तति एकयुक्तं
36c °yugaṃ CK82; °yuga° E • ekayuktaṃ C94C02K82E; ekamuktaṃ C45
     manvantarā saṃkhyam udāharanti ||21.36||     मन्वन्तरा संख्यमुदाहरन्ति ॥२१:३६
manvantarāṇāṃ ca caturdaśaiva मन्वन्तराणां च चतुर्दशैव
37 omitted in E 37a ca C94C45K82E; tu C02
     kalpasya saṃkhyā munayo vadanti |     कल्पस्य संख्या मुनयो वदन्ति ।
kalpāyutaś cāha pitāmahasya कल्पायुतश्चाह पितामहस्य
     tathā ca rātriṃ pravadanti tajjñāḥ ||21.37||     तथा च रात्रिं प्रवदन्ति तज्ज्ञाः ॥२१:३७
ṣaḍlakṣakalpena tu māsam āhus षड्लक्षकल्पेन तु मासमाहुस्
38a lakṣakalpena tu māsam āhus C45C02K82E; lakṣaka×××××m āhus C94
     taddvādaśā varṣam udāharanti ||21.38||     तद्द्वादशा वर्षमुदाहरन्ति ॥२१:३८
38b taddvādaśā va° corr.; tadvādaśā va° C94C45, tatadvādaśā va° C02, tadvādaśād va° K82, tvaddvādaśava° E
tenābdena parārdhakalpaguṇitaṃ brahmāyur ity ucyate तेनाब्देन परार्धकल्पगुणितं ब्रह्मायुरित्युच्यते
39a °bdena CK82; °rdhena E
     trailokyādhipatiḥ pradhānapuruṣo brahmāpy anityaḥ smṛtaḥ |     त्रैलोक्याधिपतिः प्रधानपुरुषो ब्रह्माप्यनित्यः स्मृतः ।
39b °puruṣo C94C45K82E; °puruṣā C02
śeṣaṃ bhūtacaturvidhasya niyataṃ jīvasya kiṃ śocyate शेषं भूतचतुर्विधस्य नियतं जीवस्य किं शोच्यते
     tasmān nāsti jagatsusāravimalaṃ muktvā śivaṃ śāśvatam ||21.39||     तस्मान्नास्ति जगत्सुसारविमलं मुक्त्वा शिवं शाश्वतम् ॥२१:३९
39d °vimalaṃ muktvā C02; °viralaṃ muktvā C94C45K82, °viralamuktā E
iti vṛṣasārasaṃgrahe kalpanirṇayo nāmaikaviṃśatimo 'dhyāyaḥ इति वृषसारसंग्रहे कल्पनिर्णयो नामैकविंशतिमो ऽध्यायः
Colophon: °viṃśatimo CK82; °viṃśatitamo E



22 varṇagotrāśramaḥ
janamejaya uvāca | जनमेजय उवाच ।
śruto 'thābjamukhād dharmasārasaṃgraham uttamam | श्रुतो ऽथाब्जमुखाद्धर्मसारसंग्रहमुत्तमम् ।
1a śruto 'thābjamukhād dharma° eme.; śruto vābjamukhād dharmaḥ C94, śruto vābjamukhod dharmaḥ C45, śruto vābjamukhā dharmaḥ C02, śruto cābjamukhād dharmaḥ K82L, śruto cābdamukhā dharmaḥ K10, śrutvā vābjamukhād dharmaḥ K07, śruto vā tvanmukhād dharmaḥ E Testimonia for this chapter: C94 ff. 232r–234v, C45 ff. 233v–235r, C02 ff. 314r–317r, K82 ff. 39r–41v, K10 ff. 241v–243v, K07 ff. 247v–250r; C = C94 + C45 + C02
madhuraślakṣṇavāṇībhiḥ samyagvedārthasaṃyutam ||22.1|| मधुरश्लक्ष्णवाणीभिः सम्यग्वेदार्थसंयुतम् ॥२२:१
1c °ślakṣṇavāṇī° C45C02K82K10K07; ślakṣṇaṇī° C94, °ślakṣyavānī° L, °ślakṣṇāvāṇī° E
nyāyayuktaṃ mahāsāraṃ guhyajñānam anuttaram | न्याययुक्तं महासारं गुह्यज्ञानमनुत्तरम् ।
2a nyāyayuktaṃ mahāsāraṃ C94C02K10K07E; nyāyam uktaṃ mahat sāraṃ C45, nyāyayuktaṃ mahat sāraṃ K82L 2b guhya° CK82K10K07L; guhyaṃ E • °nuttaram C94K82K10L; °nuttamam C45C02K07, °nantaram E
tṛpto 'smīhāmṛtaṃ pītvā janmamṛtyurujāpaham ||22.2|| तृप्तो ऽस्मीहामृतं पीत्वा जन्ममृत्युरुजापहम् ॥२२:२
2cd pītvā janma° C45C02K82K10K07LE; pī××nma C94 2d °rujā° C94C02K82K10K07LE; °mujā° C45
praśnam ekānya pṛcchāmi nāmahetuṃ tapodhana | प्रश्नमेकान्य पृच्छामि नामहेतुं तपोधन ।
3a praśna° CK82K07LE; prasta° K10 • °kānya CK10K07; °kānyat K82 (unmetrical), °kāṃnyat L (unmetrical), °konya E 3b nāma° CK82K10LE; nāya° K07 • °hetuṃ C94C45K82L; °hetu C02K10K07E • °dhana CK10K07E; °dhanam K82L
varṇagotrāśramaṃ tasmāc chrotum icchāmi te punaḥ ||22.3|| वर्णगोत्राश्रमं तस्माच्छ्रोतुमिच्छामि ते पुनः ॥२२:३
3c varṇa° CK82K10K07BL; varṇaṃ E
vaiśampāyana uvāca | वैशम्पायन उवाच ।
4 uvāca CK82K10LE; ××× K07
śṛṇu rājann avahito yogendrasya mahātmanaḥ | शृणु राजन्नवहितो योगेन्द्रस्य महात्मनः ।
4a rājann a° C45C02K82K07LE; rājan a° C94K10 4ab °vahito yogendrasya CK82pcK10K07E; °vahito yogendra K82ac, °hito yogandrasya L
āśramaṃ varṇajātīnāṃ vakṣyāmy eva narādhipa ||22.4|| आश्रमं वर्णजातीनां वक्ष्याम्येव नराधिप ॥२२:४
4d vakṣyāmy eva C94C02K82K10E; vakṣyām eva C45K07L • °pa CK82K10K07L; °paḥ E
himavaddakṣiṇe pārśve mṛgendraśikhare nṛpa | हिमवद्दक्षिणे पार्श्वे मृगेन्द्रशिखरे नृप ।
5b mṛgendra° C45C02K82K10K07LE; mṛ×ndra° C94 • nṛpa CK82K10; nṛpaḥ K07LE
mahendrapathagā nāma nadītīre narādhipa ||22.5|| महेन्द्रपथगा नाम नदीतीरे नराधिप ॥२२:५
5c mahendra° CK82K07E; mṛgendra° K10, mahindra° L 5d °pa CK82K10K07L; °paḥ E
tatrāśramapadaṃ tasya puline sumanorame | तत्राश्रमपदं तस्य पुलिने सुमनोरमे ।
6b puline su° C94C45K82; pulineṣu C02K10K07E, puline pu° L
vasati sma mahābhāgas tattvapāraganispṛhaḥ ||22.6|| वसति स्म महाभागस्तत्त्वपारगनिस्पृहः ॥२२:६
6c vasati CK82K10K07E; vasanti L 6d °pāraga° C94C02K82K10K07LE; °pāra° C45 • °spṛhaḥ CK82K10K07L; °spṛhāḥ E
śīlaśaucasamācāro jitadvandvo jitaśramaḥ | शीलशौचसमाचारो जितद्वन्द्वो जितश्रमः ।
jitamānabhayakrodho jitasarvaparigrahaḥ ||22.7|| जितमानभयक्रोधो जितसर्वपरिग्रहः ॥२२:७
7d jita° C94C02K82K10K07LE; jija° C45
somavaṃśaprasūtās te kṣatriyā dvijatāṃ gatāḥ | सोमवंशप्रसूतास्ते क्षत्रिया द्विजतां गताः ।

ajitā nāma tat pūrvaṃ kāmakrodhajitena tu | अजिता नाम तत्पूर्वं कामक्रोधजितेन तु ।

10ab °sphītaḥ adhi° C45C02K82K10K07LE; °sphītaradhi° C94
adhidaivatasāṃnidhyaṃ daśāyatana pañca ca ||22.10|| अधिदैवतसांनिध्यं दशायतन पञ्च च ॥२२:१०
10c °sāṃnidhyaṃ C94E; sānaidhyaṃ C45C02K82K10L, sānnaidhyaṃ K07 10d daśā° CK82K10K07L; deśā° E 10 Cf. 4.72: caturāyatanaṃ vipra kathayiṣyāmi tac chṛṇu| karuṇāmuditopekṣāmaitrī cāyātanaṃ smṛtam||

11a daśayajñavrataṃ cīrṇaṃ K82K10K07L; daśayajñaṃ ××ñ cīrṇan C94, daśayajñavratacīrṇan C45C02, daśayajñaṃ vrataṃ cīrṇa° E 11b °parājitaḥ C94C02K82K10K07LE; °paparājitaḥ C45

14a °bhaya CK82K10K07L; °gnaya E

20a anirodha° CK82K10K07L; anilādha° E • °manāḥ CK82K07LE; °manā K10 20b dhyāyed yo° C94C45K82K10K07L; dhyāyo° C02, dhyānaṃ yo° E 20ab cf. Dharmaputrikā 1.54: akṛtvā prāṇasaṃrodhaṃ manasaikena kevalam| dhyāyeta paramaṃ sūkṣmaṃ sa yogo mānasaḥ smṛtaḥ||

20c °yāmair ma° C94K82K10K07pcLE; °yāmai ma° C45, °yāmai mma° C02, °yāmer ma° K07ac • ruddhvā CK82K10K07L; ruddhā E 20d yauga° C94C45K82K07pcL; yoga° C02K10K07acE 20cd cf. Dharmaputrikā 1.55: saṃyamya manasā prāṇaṃ prāṇāyāmair manas tathā| evaṃ dhyāyet paraṃ sūkṣmaṃ yaugapadyaḥ sa ucyate||

24a jñeyaṃ C94C45K82EK07; jñeya C02L, jñe K10ac; jñe× K10pc 24b tu paṅkajam C45C02K82K10K07LE; tu pa×× C94

daśayogam idaṃ rājan kathitaṃ ca mayā tava | दशयोगमिदं राजन्कथितं च मया तव ।
daśadhyānaṃ samāsena kīrtitaṃ śṛṇu tad yathā ||22.28|| दशध्यानं समासेन कीर्तितं शृणु तद्यथा ॥२२:२८

30c supiṣitvāṅgulau C94C45K82K10K07; su×iṣicāṅgulau C02, supithitvāṅgulau L, suśiṣi cāṅgulau E 30d °karṇaye° K10; °karṣaye° CK82K07E, °karṣaya° L
tat tad akṣaram ākarṇya amṛtatvāya kalpyate | तत्तदक्षरमाकर्ण्य अमृतत्वाय कल्प्यते ।
31a °karṇya CK10K07LE; °kaṇṇya K82
piṅgalāṃ tu śikhādhūmāṃ dhyāyen nityam atandritaḥ ||22.31|| पिङ्गलां तु शिखाधूमां ध्यायेन्नित्यमतन्द्रितः ॥२२:३१
31c piṅgalāṃ tu śikhādhūmāṃ C94C45K10L; piṅgalā tu śikhādhūmaṃ C02E, piṅgalāṃn tu śikhādhūmāṃ K82, piṅgalān tu śikhādhūmā K07 31d °tandritaḥ CK82K10K07E; °tendritaḥ L
vimuktaḥ sarvapāpebhyo nirdvandvapadam āpnuyāt | विमुक्तः सर्वपापेभ्यो निर्द्वन्द्वपदमाप्नुयात् ।
32a vimuktaḥ C94C45K82K10K07LE; vimukta C02 32b nirdvandva° CK07; nidvanda° K82K10L, nirdvanda° E
vaidyutī tu niśāmadhye lakṣate 'jam anāmayam ||22.32|| वैद्युती तु निशामध्ये लक्षते ऽजमनामयम् ॥२२:३२
32c vaidyutī tu CK82K10K07E; vaidyutīnta L 32d lakṣate 'jam a° C02E; lakṣye teja a° C94C45, lakṣyateja a° K82K10L, lakṣateja a° K07
pañcamāsasadābhyāsād divyacakṣur bhaven naraḥ | पञ्चमाससदाभ्यासाद्दिव्यचक्षुर्भवेन्नरः ।
33a pañcamāsasadā° C45K82K10L; pa××sasadā° C94, pañcamāsassadā° C02, pañcamāsasamā° E, pañcamāsaṃ sadā° K07 33ab °sād di CK82K10LE; °sā di° K07 33b °kṣur bhaven na° C94C45K82E; °kṣur bhave na° C02, °kṣu bhaven na° K10L, °rkṣu bhaven na K07
bindumālāṃ tataḥ paśyet tarucchāyāsamāśritām ||22.33|| बिन्दुमालां ततः पश्येत्तरुच्छायासमाश्रिताम् ॥२२:३३
33c tataḥ paśyet CK82K10K07L; tu yaḥ paśyen E 33d tarucchāyā° CK82K10K07L; naracchāyāṃ E • °śritām CK10; °śritāḥ K82L, °śritam K07E
jātyasphaṭikasaṃkāśaṃ dṛṣṭvā mucyati bandhanaiḥ | जात्यस्फटिकसंकाशं दृष्ट्वा मुच्यति बन्धनैः ।
34a °kasaṃkāśaṃ CK82K10K07LpcE; °saṃkakāśaṃ Lpc 34b bandhanaiḥ C94K82K07; bandhavaiḥ C45, bandhanāt C02K10E, vaṃcanaiḥ L
dhyāyen mano'nugā nāma pakṣmīr āpīḍya locane ||22.34|| ध्यायेन्मनोऽनुगा नाम पक्ष्मीरापीड्य लोचने ॥२२:३४
34d pakṣmī° CK82L; yakṣmī K10, yakṣmo° K07, pakṣī° E • locane C94C45K82L; locanaḥ K10, locanaiḥ C02E, locanai K07
śvetapītāruṇaṃ binduṃ dṛṣṭvā bhūyo na jāyate | श्वेतपीतारुणं बिन्दुं दृष्ट्वा भूयो न जायते ।
mano'nugādi ṣaṭ tv ete dhyānam uktaṃ mayā tava ||22.35|| मनोऽनुगादि षट्त्वेते ध्यानमुक्तं मया तव ॥२२:३५
35c °ṣaṭ tv ete C94K82K10K07L; °ṣaṭ tv etā C45, °ṣaṭkena C02E 35d °ktaṃ mayā tava C02K82K07LE; ka×× tava C94, °ktaṃ samāsataḥ C45, °kta mayā tava K10
paramāṇuḥ
adhunānyat pravakṣyāmi paramāṇu caturvidham | अधुनान्यत्प्रवक्ष्यामि परमाणु चतुर्विधम् ।
pārthivādicaturbhūtair yair vyāptaṃ nikhilaṃ jagat ||22.36|| पार्थिवादिचतुर्भूतैर्यैर्व्याप्तं निखिलं जगत् ॥२२:३६
lakṣaṇaṃ tasya rājendra śṛṇu vakṣyāmi sāmpratam | लक्षणं तस्य राजेन्द्र शृणु वक्ष्यामि साम्प्रतम् ।
pārthivordhagatiḥ ! sūkṣmaḥ paramāṇur narādhipa ||22.37|| पार्थिवोर्धगतिः ! सूक्ष्मः परमाणुर्नराधिप ॥२२:३७
pratyakṣadarśanaṃ dhyānaṃ lakṣayan niyataḥ śuciḥ | प्रत्यक्षदर्शनं ध्यानं लक्षयन्नियतः शुचिः ।
mucyate sarvapāpebhyo rāhunā candramā yathā ||22.38|| मुच्यते सर्वपापेभ्यो राहुना चन्द्रमा यथा ॥२२:३८
tena yo 'bhyasate nityaṃ sa yogī bhuvaneśvara | तेन यो ऽभ्यसते नित्यं स योगी भुवनेश्वर ।
adhogati mahārāja paramāṇu jalodbhuvaḥ ||22.39|| अधोगति महाराज परमाणु जलोद्भुवः ॥२२:३९
abhyased yad idaṃ rājan sarvapātakanāśanam | अभ्यसेद्यदिदं राजन्सर्वपातकनाशनम् ।
āgneyaparamāṇuś ca tiryagūrdhagatiḥ ! smṛtāḥ ||22.40|| आग्नेयपरमाणुश्च तिर्यगूर्धगतिः ! स्मृताः ॥२२:४०
ya idaṃ dhyāyate nityam uttamāṃ gatim āpnuyāt | य इदं ध्यायते नित्यमुत्तमां गतिमाप्नुयात् ।
vāyavyaṃ paramāṇuś ca adhordhvatiryag āsmṛtā ||22.41|| वायव्यं परमाणुश्च अधोर्ध्वतिर्यगास्मृता ॥२२:४१
na sa muhyati taṃ dṛṣṭvā vāyusambhava bhūpate | न स मुह्यति तं दृष्ट्वा वायुसम्भव भूपते ।
catvāra ete rājendra paramāṇur nirīkṣate ||22.42|| चत्वार एते राजेन्द्र परमाणुर्निरीक्षते ॥२२:४२
tena sarvamakhairiṣṭaṃ tena taptaṃ taptaṃ tathā | तेन सर्वमखैरिष्टं तेन तप्तं तप्तं तथा ।
tena dattā mahī kṛtsnā saptasāgarasaṃvṛtā ||22.43|| तेन दत्ता मही कृत्स्ना सप्तसागरसंवृता ॥२२:४३
sarvatīrthābhiṣekaś ca sarvavratakriyā tathā | सर्वतीर्थाभिषेकश्च सर्वव्रतक्रिया तथा ।
anenaiva vidhānena daśadhyānaṃ narādhipa | अनेनैव विधानेन दशध्यानं नराधिप ।
kurute avyavacchinnaṃ sarvakāmaphalapradam ||22.44|| कुरुते अव्यवच्छिन्नं सर्वकामफलप्रदम् ॥२२:४४
daśākṣaramantraḥ
daśākṣaramahārāja yogīndrasya mahātmanaḥ | दशाक्षरमहाराज योगीन्द्रस्य महात्मनः ।
kathayāmi samāsena śṛṇuṣvāvahito bhava ||22.45|| कथयामि समासेन शृणुष्वावहितो भव ॥२२:४५
praṇavādisvarā trīṇi dīrghabindusamāyutam | प्रणवादिस्वरा त्रीणि दीर्घबिन्दुसमायुतम् ।
pañca pañca cavarge tu vāyubījam adhasthitam ||22.46|| पञ्च पञ्च चवर्गे तु वायुबीजमधस्थितम् ॥२२:४६
trayodaśasvarāyuktaṃ pañcama parikīrtitam | त्रयोदशस्वरायुक्तं पञ्चम परिकीर्तितम् ।
pañcaviṃśatimaḥ ṣaṣṭha akṣaraḥ parikīrtitaḥ ||22.47|| पञ्चविंशतिमः षष्ठ अक्षरः परिकीर्तितः ॥२२:४७
yādṛśaṃ pañcamaḥ proktaṃ saptame ca prayojayet | यादृशं पञ्चमः प्रोक्तं सप्तमे च प्रयोजयेत् ।
akārasvarasaṃyuktaṃ sarvapātakanāśanam ||22.48|| अकारस्वरसंयुक्तं सर्वपातकनाशनम् ॥२२:४८
prathamaṃ pañcame varge tṛtīyasvarayojitam | प्रथमं पञ्चमे वर्गे तृतीयस्वरयोजितम् ।
uktare kārasaṃyuktaṃ navamaṃ parikīrtitam ||22.49|| उक्तरे कारसंयुक्तं नवमं परिकीर्तितम् ॥२२:४९
daśamaḥ punar oṃkāraḥ mantraśreṣṭho daśākṣaraḥ | दशमः पुनरोंकारः मन्त्रश्रेष्ठो दशाक्षरः ।
japato dhyāyate vāpi pārthivādi krameṇa tu ||22.50|| जपतो ध्यायते वापि पार्थिवादि क्रमेण तु ॥२२:५०
mucyate so 'pi saṃsāre saṃśayo nāsti bhūpate | मुच्यते सो ऽपि संसारे संशयो नास्ति भूपते ।
ācāramūlo dharmas tu dharmamūlo janārdanaḥ | आचारमूलो धर्मस्तु धर्ममूलो जनार्दनः ।
tena sarvajagad vyāptaṃ trailokyaṃ sa carācaraṃ ||22.51|| तेन सर्वजगद्व्याप्तं त्रैलोक्यं स चराचरं ॥२२:५१
ācārāl labhatīha āyur atulam aiśvaryavittaṃ tathā आचाराल्लभतीह आयुरतुलमैश्वर्यवित्तं तथा
     ācārāt sutam īpsitaṃ ca labhate śrīkīrtiprajñāyaśaḥ |     आचारात्सुतमीप्सितं च लभते श्रीकीर्तिप्रज्ञायशः ।
ācārāl labhate ca lakṣmim atulaṃ khyātiṃ tathaivottamam आचाराल्लभते च लक्ष्मिमतुलं ख्यातिं तथैवोत्तमम्
     ācārād iha mantradharmaparamaṃ prāpnoti niḥsaṃśayam ||22.52||     आचारादिह मन्त्रधर्मपरमं प्राप्नोति निःसंशयम् ॥२२:५२
janamejaya uvāca | जनमेजय उवाच ।
ācārāt prabhavānusaṅgakathitaṃ suśliṣṭadharmākaram आचारात्प्रभवानुसङ्गकथितं सुश्लिष्टधर्माकरम्
     ācārāt katidhāṅga kīrtaya punas tṛptir na me jāyate |     आचारात्कतिधाङ्ग कीर्तय पुनस्तृप्तिर्न मे जायते ।
sarvajñaḥ tvam ahaṃ śṛṇomi varadaṃ kiñcin na me śāśvaram सर्वज्ञः त्वमहं शृणोमि वरदं किञ्चिन्न मे शाश्वरम्
     tan me kīrtaya dharmasāraśubhadam ācāramūlāśrayam ||22.53||     तन्मे कीर्तय धर्मसारशुभदमाचारमूलाश्रयम् ॥२२:५३
vaiśampāyana uvāca | वैशम्पायन उवाच ।
nityaṃ namraśirodvijātiguruṣu śuśrūṣaṇaṃ daivatam नित्यं नम्रशिरोद्विजातिगुरुषु शुश्रूषणं दैवतम्
     tiṣṭhenācamanena cāśanakaraṃ vāmāsthimānādaram |     तिष्ठेनाचमनेन चाशनकरं वामास्थिमानादरम् ।
sūryāgniśaśibandhur āryapurataḥ kuryān na cāvaśyakam सूर्याग्निशशिबन्धुरार्यपुरतः कुर्यान्न चावश्यकम्
     śasye bhasmani govrajedvijajalaṃ kuryān na cārkaṃ naraḥ ||22.54||     शस्ये भस्मनि गोव्रजेद्विजजलं कुर्यान्न चार्कं नरः ॥२२:५४
pādenāgnijalaṃ spṛśen na ca guruṃ pādena pādaṃ tathā पादेनाग्निजलं स्पृशेन्न च गुरुं पादेन पादं तथा
     śaucaṃ kārya jalādinā ca niyataṃ nādho jalaṃ kārayet |     शौचं कार्य जलादिना च नियतं नाधो जलं कारयेत् ।
kuryān nityabhivādanaṃ dvijaguror mātāpitṛr daivatam कुर्यान्नित्यभिवादनं द्विजगुरोर्मातापितृर्दैवतम्
     etācāravidhiḥ samāsaniyamas tubhyaṃ mayā kīrtitam ||22.55||     एताचारविधिः समासनियमस्तुभ्यं मया कीर्तितम् ॥२२:५५
janamejaya uvāca | जनमेजय उवाच ।
strīṇāṃ kiṃ priyam asti tad vada vibho saṃsārasārastriyām स्त्रीणां किं प्रियमस्ति तद्वद विभो संसारसारस्त्रियाम्
     kiṃ sadbhāva na vedmi tasya viṣaye kiṃ dveṣya kiṃ tātpriyam |     किं सद्भाव न वेद्मि तस्य विषये किं द्वेष्य किं तात्प्रियम् ।
paśyāmi na ca tasya garbhakalayā prāpnoti niḥsaṃśayam पश्यामि न च तस्य गर्भकलया प्राप्नोति निःसंशयम्
     māyājālasahasragāpi yuvatī kurvanti bhartā priyam ||22.56||     मायाजालसहस्रगापि युवती कुर्वन्ति भर्ता प्रियम् ॥२२:५६
vaiśampāyana uvāca | वैशम्पायन उवाच ।
rājan kiṃ priyam asti arthaparataḥ paśyāmi nānyan nṛpe राजन्किं प्रियमस्ति अर्थपरतः पश्यामि नान्यन्नृपे
     putrārthaikaprayojanaṃ yuvatayaḥ svāyambhuvoktāmaraiḥ |     पुत्रार्थैकप्रयोजनं युवतयः स्वायम्भुवोक्तामरैः ।
kāntā nityakalā pravartanakarī dharmasakhāyā satī कान्ता नित्यकला प्रवर्तनकरी धर्मसखाया सती
     māyā vāpi karoti sadya manujātyaktānya vā sevate ||22.57||     माया वापि करोति सद्य मनुजात्यक्तान्य वा सेवते ॥२२:५७
strīsaṅgaṃ parivarjayen narapate āyāsadaṃ duḥkhadam स्त्रीसङ्गं परिवर्जयेन्नरपते आयासदं दुःखदम्
     mṛtyudvārabhayākaraṃ viṣagṛham āpat sughorālayam |     मृत्युद्वारभयाकरं विषगृहमापत्सुघोरालयम् ।
agnir mārutamattavāraṇasama tasyānugāmī sadā अग्निर्मारुतमत्तवारणसम तस्यानुगामी सदा
     strīhetor hatarāvaṇastridaśapa indro 'pi visthāpitaḥ |     स्त्रीहेतोर्हतरावणस्त्रिदशप इन्द्रो ऽपि विस्थापितः ।
     strīhetor api candramāstribhuvane dhiktāṃ gataś cāmaro |     स्त्रीहेतोरपि चन्द्रमास्त्रिभुवने धिक्तां गतश्चामरो ।
     daṇḍakṣo hatarāṣṭrapaurasahitaḥ kiṃ bhūya vakṣyāmy aham ||22.58||     दण्डक्षो हतराष्ट्रपौरसहितः किं भूय वक्ष्याम्यहम् ॥२२:५८
janamejaya uvāca | जनमेजय उवाच ।
vipro kīdṛśalakṣaṇaṃ bhavati bho kīdṛg muniś cocyate विप्रो कीदृशलक्षणं भवति भो कीदृग्मुनिश्चोच्यते
     kenārthena bhaveta bhikṣu bhagavan nighnanti ko vā dvija |     केनार्थेन भवेत भिक्षु भगवन्निघ्नन्ति को वा द्विज ।
kenārthena bhaved dvijendra bhagavān jñeyaḥ parivrājakaḥ केनार्थेन भवेद्द्विजेन्द्र भगवान्ज्ञेयः परिव्राजकः
     ! jñeyāḥ kim ṛṣayaś ca lakṣaṇamuner icchāmi jñātuṃ punaḥ ||22.59||     ! ज्ञेयाः किमृषयश्च लक्षणमुनेरिच्छामि ज्ञातुं पुनः ॥२२:५९
vaiśampāyana uvāca | वैशम्पायन उवाच ।
satyaṃ śaucam ahiṃsatā damaśamau bhūtānukampī sadā सत्यं शौचमहिंसता दमशमौ भूतानुकम्पी सदा
     ātmā rāmajito svadharmanirataḥ sattvastha nityaṃ manaḥ |     आत्मा रामजितो स्वधर्मनिरतः सत्त्वस्थ नित्यं मनः ।
kāmakrodhayamasvadāranirataḥ saṃtyajya lobhaḥ śanaiḥ कामक्रोधयमस्वदारनिरतः संत्यज्य लोभः शनैः
     evaṃ yaḥ kurute dvijātisuvaraḥ śūdro 'pi yaḥ saṃyamī ||22.60||     एवं यः कुरुते द्विजातिसुवरः शूद्रो ऽपि यः संयमी ॥२२:६०
tasmāc chadmakavarjitaḥ sa bhagavān saṃsārabhībhidyakaḥ तस्माच्छद्मकवर्जितः स भगवान्संसारभीभिद्यकः
     yat tat sthānaparaṃ vrajanti puruṣāḥ tasmāt parivrājakaḥ |     यत्तत्स्थानपरं व्रजन्ति पुरुषाः तस्मात्परिव्राजकः ।
granthi dārasutaṃ dhanaṃś ca virati nirgranthika socyate ग्रन्थि दारसुतं धनंश्च विरति निर्ग्रन्थिक सोच्यते
     ramyante ṛṣirāśrame dhṛtimanas tasmād ṛṣiḥ socyate ||22.61||     रम्यन्ते ऋषिराश्रमे धृतिमनस्तस्मादृषिः सोच्यते ॥२२:६१
kāyavāṅmanadaṇḍatatparataras te daṇḍikarūcyate कायवाङ्मनदण्डतत्परतरस्ते दण्डिकरूच्यते
     saddharmaśravaṇaṃ vadanti śravaṇaḥ saddharmabrahmākṣaraḥ |     सद्धर्मश्रवणं वदन्ति श्रवणः सद्धर्मब्रह्माक्षरः ।
pāśaprakṣipataṃ paśutvasakalaṃ pāśūpatās te smṛtāḥ पाशप्रक्षिपतं पशुत्वसकलं पाशूपतास्ते स्मृताः
     vipre pāśupatādibhikṣusakalaṃ pṛṣṭo 'smy ahaṃ lakṣaṇam ||22.62||     विप्रे पाशुपतादिभिक्षुसकलं पृष्टो ऽस्म्यहं लक्षणम् ॥२२:६२
sarvaṃ tat kathito 'si lakṣaṇa mayā sandhiśvanirnāśanam सर्वं तत्कथितो ऽसि लक्षण मया सन्धिश्वनिर्नाशनम्
     prajñāsaṃgrahaśītavardhanaparaṃ saṃsāranirmūlanam |     प्रज्ञासंग्रहशीतवर्धनपरं संसारनिर्मूलनम् ।
     etaj jñānaparaṃ prabodham atulaṃ nityaṃ śivaṃ dhāryate ||22.63||     एतज्ज्ञानपरं प्रबोधमतुलं नित्यं शिवं धार्यते ॥२२:६३
iti vṛṣasārasaṃgrahe dvāviṃśatitamo 'dhyāyaḥ इति वृषसारसंग्रहे द्वाविंशतितमो ऽध्यायः



23 nidrotpattiḥ
janamejaya uvāca | जनमेजय उवाच ।
devānāṃ dānavānāṃ ca uttarāraṇim eva ca | देवानां दानवानां च उत्तरारणिमेव च ।
1ab dānavānāṃ ca uttarāraṇim eva K82E; dā×××××××ṇim eva C94
vidviṣanti ca te 'nyonyaṃ kāraṇaṃ tasya kīrtaya ||23.1|| विद्विषन्ति च ते ऽन्योन्यं कारणं तस्य कीर्तय ॥२३:१
1d tasya C94E; tasya K82
vaiśampāyana uvāca | वैशम्पायन उवाच ।
pāpapuṇyasvabhāvābhyāṃ devadaityasya bhūpate | पापपुण्यस्वभावाभ्यां देवदैत्यस्य भूपते ।
dharmapakṣasmṛto devo dānavo 'dharmapakṣataḥ ||23.2|| धर्मपक्षस्मृतो देवो दानवो ऽधर्मपक्षतः ॥२३:२
2c dharmapakṣa° K82; dharme pakṣaḥ C94, dharmapakṣaḥ E • devo C94K82; devā E 2d 'dharma° E; darppa° C94, darpa° K82
hetunā tena rājendra anyonyaṃ vidviṣanti te | हेतुना तेन राजेन्द्र अन्योन्यं विद्विषन्ति ते ।
devadveṣṭāsurāḥ sarve vibudhāś cāsuradviṣaḥ ||23.3|| देवद्वेष्टासुराः सर्वे विबुधाश्चासुरद्विषः ॥२३:३
3c devadveṣṭāsurāḥ sarve eme.; devadveṣṭāsuraḥ sarveK82E, devadveṣṭāsuras ×× C94 3d vibudhāś K82E; ××dhāś C94
dharmādharmavipakṣatāṃ śṛṇu parāṃ bhūtānukampodayām धर्माधर्मविपक्षतां शृणु परां भूतानुकम्पोदयाम्
4a °vipakṣatāṃ E; °vivakṣatāṃ C94K82 • °kampodayām C94K82; °kampādayām E
     satyaṃ śaucam ahiṃsatā damaśamo nirmānam īrṣyāruṣā |     सत्यं शौचमहिंसता दमशमो निर्मानमीर्ष्यारुषा ।
4b īrṣā° C94K82; īrṣyā° E
tṛṣṇālobharatasya kāmaviṣayaḥ sarvendriyāṇāṃ jayaḥ तृष्णालोभरतस्य कामविषयः सर्वेन्द्रियाणां जयः
     ādhyātmeṣu ratiḥ prasannamanaso nirdvandvasarvālayaḥ ||23.4||     आध्यात्मेषु रतिः प्रसन्नमनसो निर्द्वन्द्वसर्वालयः ॥२३:४
4d prasannamanaso nirdvandva° K82E; prasanna××××× C94
pāpopekṣaṇaśaśvapuṇyamudito dīneṣu kāruṇyatā पापोपेक्षणशश्वपुण्यमुदितो दीनेषु कारुण्यता
5a pāpo° C94K82; pāpā° E • °śaśva° C94K82; °śaśca° E
     dānaṃ śīladhṛtikṣamājapatapaḥ svādhyāyamaune ratiḥ |     दानं शीलधृतिक्षमाजपतपः स्वाध्यायमौने रतिः ।
yogābhyāsaratir divaukasagaṇe jñāne ca sāṃkhye tathā योगाभ्यासरतिर्दिवौकसगणे ज्ञाने च सांख्ये तथा
5c yogābhyāsaratir divaukasa° C94; yogābhyāsaratidivaukasa° K82 (unmetrical), yogabhyāsaratidivaikasa° E (unmetrical)
     akrodhārjavatejayajñam abhayaṃ saṃtoṣa adrohatā ||23.5||     अक्रोधार्जवतेजयज्ञमभयं संतोष अद्रोहता ॥२३:५
5d °bhayaṃ E; °bhayas C94, °bhayaḥ K82
tyāgo mārdavahrīr acāpalaratir nyāsābhimāno grahāt त्यागो मार्दवह्रीरचापलरतिर्न्यासाभिमानो ग्रहात्
6a °hrīr acāpalaratinyāsā° K82E; hrī××××ratir nyāsā° C94
     maitrībhāvasadārapaiśunamatir brāhmaṇyaśraddhānvitaḥ |     मैत्रीभावसदारपैशुनमतिर्ब्राह्मण्यश्रद्धान्वितः ।
6b °nvitaḥ K82; °nvitā C94E
etācāra sadā narendra vibudhāḥ saṃkṣepataḥ kīrtitāḥ एताचार सदा नरेन्द्र विबुधाः संक्षेपतः कीर्तिताः
6c kīrtitāḥ C94K82; kīrtitaḥ E
     daityānāṃ śṛṇu kīrtaye svavahito 'sambhāvya teṣāṃ nijam ||23.6||     दैत्यानां शृणु कीर्तये स्ववहितो ऽसम्भाव्य तेषां निजम् ॥२३:६
6d daityānāṃ K82E; daityānā C94 • kīrtaye C94E; kīrtaya K82 • svavahito C94; svavahisaṃ K82, tv avahito E • nijam C94E; nijaḥ K82
daityāḥ pāparatisvabhāvacapalā nirlajjadarpālasāḥ दैत्याः पापरतिस्वभावचपला निर्लज्जदर्पालसाः
7a daityāḥ C94; daityā K82E
     kāmakrodhavaśāḥ suduṣṭamanasas tṛṣṇādhikā nirdayāḥ |     कामक्रोधवशाः सुदुष्टमनसस्तृष्णाधिका निर्दयाः ।
7b kāmakrodhavaśāḥ K82E; *××××śās C94
śaucācāravivarjitā gurugirānnānitya kuryuḥ kriyāḥ शौचाचारविवर्जिता गुरुगिरान्नानित्य कुर्युः क्रियाः
     jīvākarṣaṇajīvanaḥ pratidinaṃ mohāndharāgānvitāḥ ||23.7||     जीवाकर्षणजीवनः प्रतिदिनं मोहान्धरागान्विताः ॥२३:७
7d jīvākarṣaṇa° C94K82; naivākarṣaṇa° E
nidrā nitya divā prasaktam aśuciḥ sūryodaye supyate निद्रा नित्य दिवा प्रसक्तमशुचिः सूर्योदये सुप्यते
     āśāpāśaśatair nibaddhahṛdayo hṛtvā parasvaṃ punaḥ |     आशापाशशतैर्निबद्धहृदयो हृत्वा परस्वं पुनः ।
8b hṛtvā parasvaṃ punaḥ K82E; hṛ×××××naḥ C94
mātsaryāt parapākabhedanirato mūlasya duṣpūratā मात्सर्यात्परपाकभेदनिरतो मूलस्य दुष्पूरता
8c mātsaryā C94K82; māṃsaryā° E
     ! nāstīkatvaparāṅganāsvabhirata utkocakāmaḥ sadā ||23.8||     ! नास्तीकत्वपराङ्गनास्वभिरत उत्कोचकामः सदा ॥२३:८
8d °parāṅganāsvabhirata C94; °parāṅganās tv abhirata K82, °parāṅganāpy abhirato E • utkoca° C94K82; uktā ca E
devabrāhmaṇa vidviṣanti satataṃ lobhāc ca kāryakriyā देवब्राह्मण विद्विषन्ति सततं लोभाच्च कार्यक्रिया
     dharmaṃ dūṣayate ca mūḍhamanasā āryaṃ ca tīrthaṃ tathā |     धर्मं दूषयते च मूढमनसा आर्यं च तीर्थं तथा ।
hantavyāny ahatāś ca manyabahavo visphūrjitam adruvan हन्तव्यान्यहताश्च मन्यबहवो विस्फूर्जितमद्रुवन्
9c °hatāś C94; °hatāṃś K82, °hatāṃ E • manya° C94K82; yanya E • visphūrjitam adruvan K82; visphurjjite nakravat E, vi××××druvan C94
     daityānāṃ kathitaṃ ca cihna katicit sadbhāvataḥ kīrtitam ||23.9||     दैत्यानां कथितं च चिह्न कतिचित्सद्भावतः कीर्तितम् ॥२३:९
9d kathitaṃ C94K82; kathitaś E
martyeṣv eva narendra mānuṣam abhūd devāsurāṇāṃ nṛpaḥ मर्त्येष्वेव नरेन्द्र मानुषमभूद्देवासुराणां नृपः
     yo yaṃ proktaḥ svabhāvatām ubhayato mānuṣyaloke tathā |     यो यं प्रोक्तः स्वभावतामुभयतो मानुष्यलोके तथा ।
10b °loke C94K82; °lokan E
yan me pṛcchitavān narendra kathitaṃ yat tvaṃ purā gopitam यन्मे पृच्छितवान्नरेन्द्र कथितं यत्त्वं पुरा गोपितम्
10c pṛcchitavān K82E; pṛcchitavā C94
     vidveṣobhayakāraṇaṃ narapate kiṃ bhūya vakṣyāmy aham ||23.10||     विद्वेषोभयकारणं नरपते किं भूय वक्ष्याम्यहम् ॥२३:१०
10d vidveṣobhayakāraṇaṃ narapate kiṃ K82E; vidveṣobhaya×××××pate ki C94
janamejaya uvāca | जनमेजय उवाच ।
asti kautūhalaṃ cānyaṃ pṛcchāmi tvāṃ dvijottama | अस्ति कौतूहलं चान्यं पृच्छामि त्वां द्विजोत्तम ।
11a kautūhalaṃ C94K82; kautuhalaṃś E
kathaṃ nidrā samutpannā sarvabhūtavimohanī ||23.11|| कथं निद्रा समुत्पन्ना सर्वभूतविमोहनी ॥२३:११
11d °mohanī C94pcK82E; °mohinī C94ac
rātrau prajāyate kasmād divā kasmān na jāyate | रात्रौ प्रजायते कस्माद्दिवा कस्मान्न जायते ।
kasmāc ca kurute jantor nidrā netrapramīlanam | कस्माच्च कुरुते जन्तोर्निद्रा नेत्रप्रमीलनम् ।
12c jantor C94K82; janto E
etan me saṃśayaṃ chindhi sarvajño 'si dvijottama ||23.12|| एतन्मे संशयं छिन्धि सर्वज्ञो ऽसि द्विजोत्तम ॥२३:१२
12f sarvajño 'si K82E; ×××× C94
vaiśampāyana uvāca | वैशम्पायन उवाच ।
devī hy eṣā mahābhāgā nidrā netrāśrayā nṛṇām | देवी ह्येषा महाभागा निद्रा नेत्राश्रया नृणाम् ।
13b °śrayā C94K82; °śrayo E
tasyā vaśaṃ gataṃ sarvaṃ jagatsthāvarajaṅgamam ||23.13|| तस्या वशं गतं सर्वं जगत्स्थावरजङ्गमम् ॥२३:१३
sadevadānavagaṇā gandharvoragarākṣasāḥ | सदेवदानवगणा गन्धर्वोरगराक्षसाः ।
14a °dānava° C94E; °dānavā° K82
yakṣabhūtapiśācāś ca paśupakṣisarīsṛpāḥ ||23.14|| यक्षभूतपिशाचाश्च पशुपक्षिसरीसृपाः ॥२३:१४
14d °sarīsṛpāḥ C94K82; °śarīsṛpaḥ E
guhyakāś ca mṛgā nāgā kiṃnarā jalajoragāḥ | गुह्यकाश्च मृगा नागा किंनरा जलजोरगाः ।
15a guhyakāś ca eme.; guhyakaś ca E, guhyavastra° C94K82 • nāgāḥ C94K82; nāgā E 15b kiṃnarā jalajoragāḥ eme.; kiṃnarā jalajā nagāḥ K82E; kinna×××××gāḥ C94
nidrāvaśagatāḥ sarve pāpmanā tv abhilaṅghitāḥ ||23.15|| निद्रावशगताः सर्वे पाप्मना त्वभिलङ्घिताः ॥२३:१५
devadānavakarmānte tasminn amṛtasambhave | देवदानवकर्मान्ते तस्मिन्नमृतसम्भवे ।
16a °karmānte C94K82; °karmāt te E 16b °mṛta° C94K82; °nṛta° E
mandarotthāpane viṣṇur devāsurasamāgame ||23.16|| मन्दरोत्थापने विष्णुर्देवासुरसमागमे ॥२३:१६
16c °tthāpane E; °tpādane C94K82
jāyate vigrahe tv eṣā kṛte hy amṛtamanthane | जायते विग्रहे त्वेषा कृते ह्यमृतमन्थने ।
rajas tamaś cāsuraṃ vai sattvaṃ devakṛtaiḥ śubhaiḥ ||23.17|| रजस्तमश्चासुरं वै सत्त्वं देवकृतैः शुभैः ॥२३:१७
tataḥ sattvamayī devī rajas tamanivāsinī | ततः सत्त्वमयी देवी रजस्तमनिवासिनी ।
18ab sattvamayī devī rajas tamasi vāsinī K82; sattvamayī de××××masi vāsinī C94, sattvamayī devī rajas tamanivāsinī E
krodhajā vai sthitā madhye devadānavapakṣayoḥ ||23.18|| क्रोधजा वै स्थिता मध्ये देवदानवपक्षयोः ॥२३:१८
tām adbhutamayīṃ dṛṣṭvā vismitā devadānavāḥ | तामद्भुतमयीं दृष्ट्वा विस्मिता देवदानवाः ।
19a °bhuta° C94K82; °bhūta° E
tasyāḥ prabhāvābhihatā dudruvas te diśo daśa ||23.19|| तस्याः प्रभावाभिहता दुद्रुवस्ते दिशो दश ॥२३:१९
19d daśa C94K82; daśaḥ E
tatra pītāmbaradharo viṣṇur ekas tu tiṣṭhati | तत्र पीताम्बरधरो विष्णुरेकस्तु तिष्ठति ।
20a pītā° C94K82; pitā° E
sābhigatvā viśālākṣī nārāyaṇam athābravīt ||23.20|| साभिगत्वा विशालाक्षी नारायणमथाब्रवीत् ॥२३:२०
20c sābhi° C94;K82 sobhi° E 20d °bravīt K82E; °bra× C94
devadānavanāthas tvaṃ tvayi sarvaṃ pratiṣṭhitam | देवदानवनाथस्त्वं त्वयि सर्वं प्रतिष्ठितम् ।
21a deva° K82E; ×× C94 21b sarvaṃ C94K82; sarva° E
dehi deva mamāvāsaṃ yatrāhaṃ nivase sukham ||23.21|| देहि देव ममावासं यत्राहं निवसे सुखम् ॥२३:२१
tato nārāyaṇas tuṣṭas tāṃ devīṃ pratyabhāṣata | ततो नारायणस्तुष्टस्तां देवीं प्रत्यभाषत ।
śarīre mama vastavyaṃ viṣṇur enām athābravīt ||23.22|| शरीरे मम वस्तव्यं विष्णुरेनामथाब्रवीत् ॥२३:२२
22c vastavyaṃ E; vāstavyam C94K82
tatas tāṃ vaiṣṇavaṃ tejaḥ pāpmanā samatiṣṭhata | ततस्तां वैष्णवं तेजः पाप्मना समतिष्ठत ।
23a vaiṣṇavaṃ C94K82; viṣṇuvat E
tataḥ śete sa vaikuṇṭhaḥ pāpmanā tv abhilaṅghitaḥ ||23.23|| ततः शेते स वैकुण्ठः पाप्मना त्वभिलङ्घितः ॥२३:२३
23d pāpmanā tv abhilaṅghitaḥ K82; pāpmanā tv abhilaṅghitāḥ E, pāpma××××ghitaḥ C94
tasmin śayāne vitrastā devāsuragaṇās tathā | तस्मिन्शयाने वित्रस्ता देवासुरगणास्तथा ।
24a tasmin C94E; tasmi K82
ūcus te paramodvignāḥ śayānaṃ viṣṇum acyutam ||23.24|| ऊचुस्ते परमोद्विग्नाः शयानं विष्णुमच्युतम् ॥२३:२४
trātāraṃ nābhigacchāma uttiṣṭhottiṣṭha keśava | त्रातारं नाभिगच्छाम उत्तिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ केशव ।
tataḥ śaṅkhagadāpāṇir uttiṣṭhata mahābhujaḥ ||23.25|| ततः शङ्खगदापाणिरुत्तिष्ठत महाभुजः ॥२३:२५
utthitaś ca viśālākṣaḥ pāpmanā tasya pṛṣṭhataḥ | उत्थितश्च विशालाक्षः पाप्मना तस्य पृष्ठतः ।
26a utthita° C94K82; uttiṣṭha° E • viśālākṣaḥ C94K82; viśālākṣiḥ E
tataḥ sā vigrahavatī sthitā nārāyaṇālaye ||23.26|| ततः सा विग्रहवती स्थिता नारायणालये ॥२३:२६
26c tataḥ sā vigrahavatī K82E; tata××××vatī C94
viṣṇur devāsuragaṇān idaṃ vacanam abravīt | विष्णुर्देवासुरगणानिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।
27a viṣṇur C94E; viṣṇu K82 • °gaṇān C94E; °gaṇā K82
asmākaṃ vai śarīreṣu iyaṃ pāpmā viniḥsṛtā ||23.27|| अस्माकं वै शरीरेषु इयं पाप्मा विनिःसृता ॥२३:२७
27d viniḥsṛtā eme.; vinisṛtā C94K82E (unmetrical)
eṣābhisattvārasatā satyena bhaginī mama | एषाभिसत्त्वारसता सत्येन भगिनी मम ।
28a eṣābhisattvārasatā C94; eṣātisatvānasatā K82, eṣātisattvāmasatī E
viśrutāṃ triṣu lokeṣu tāṃ pūjayatha māṃ yathā ||23.28|| विश्रुतां त्रिषु लोकेषु तां पूजयथ मां यथा ॥२३:२८
28c °śrutāṃ C94; °śrutā K82, °śruto E
tato devāsuragaṇāḥ saptalokāḥ samānuṣāḥ | ततो देवासुरगणाः सप्तलोकाः समानुषाः ।
29b °lokāḥ samānuṣāḥ K82E; °lo×××nuṣāḥ C94
vibhaktā vaiṣṇavī pāpmā teṣu sarveṣu devatā ||23.29|| विभक्ता वैष्णवी पाप्मा तेषु सर्वेषु देवता ॥२३:२९
parvateṣv atha vṛkṣeṣu sāgareṣu saritsu ca | पर्वतेष्वथ वृक्षेषु सागरेषु सरित्सु च ।
tato nidrāvaśagataṃ jagatsthāvarajaṅgamam ||23.30|| ततो निद्रावशगतं जगत्स्थावरजङ्गमम् ॥२३:३०
eṣotpattiś ca nidrāyā yathā vasati tac chṛṇu | एषोत्पत्तिश्च निद्राया यथा वसति तच्छृणु ।
trīṇi sthānāni yasyā vai śarīreṣu śarīriṇām ||23.31|| त्रीणि स्थानानि यस्या वै शरीरेषु शरीरिणाम् ॥२३:३१
śleṣmapittānilasthāne trīṇi pakṣāṇi vāsinaḥ | श्लेष्मपित्तानिलस्थाने त्रीणि पक्षाणि वासिनः ।
32ab °nilasthāne trīṇi E; °nilasthāna trīṇi K82, ni××××ṇi C94 32b pakṣāṇi C94; pakṣā ni° K82E
tamaḥ śleṣmāśrayā nidrā rajonidrā tu vātikā ||23.32|| तमः श्लेष्माश्रया निद्रा रजोनिद्रा तु वातिका ॥२३:३२
32c tamaḥ C94K82; tama° E 32d nidrā tu C94K82; nidrāti° E
pittāśrayāṃ smṛtāṃ nidrāṃ sāttvikāṃ viddhi bhūpate | पित्ताश्रयां स्मृतां निद्रां सात्त्विकां विद्धि भूपते ।
33a smṛtāṃ C94E; smṛtā K82
ādityaprabhavaṃ tejas tasmin sattvaṃ pratiṣṭhati ||23.33|| आदित्यप्रभवं तेजस्तस्मिन्सत्त्वं प्रतिष्ठति ॥२३:३३
33d sattvaṃ pratiṣṭhati C94K82; sarva pratiṣṭhitaṃ E
nidrā divā na bhavati tasmāt sattvaguṇātmikā | निद्रा दिवा न भवति तस्मात्सत्त्वगुणात्मिका ।
yasmāt somodbhavā nidrā tamāṃsi ca rajāṃsi ca ||23.34|| यस्मात्सोमोद्भवा निद्रा तमांसि च रजांसि च ॥२३:३४
34c yasmā° C94K82; tasmā° E 34d tamāṃsi ca rajāṃsi ca K82E; tamāṃsi ca ra××× C94
tasmād rātrau bhaven nidrā tāmasī harajātmikā | तस्माद्रात्रौ भवेन्निद्रा तामसी हरजात्मिका ।
35a bhaven C94E; bhavan K82
yadā hi sarvāṅgagatau śrotāṃsi pratipadyate ||23.35|| यदा हि सर्वाङ्गगतौ श्रोतांसि प्रतिपद्यते ॥२३:३५
35c sarvā° K82E; satvā° C94
rajas tamaś ca niyatas tadā nidrā pravartate | रजस्तमश्च नियतस्तदा निद्रा प्रवर्तते ।
36a niyatas C94K82; niyataṃs E
tamasy ūrdhvagataśroto hy akṣipakṣmāsamāśritā ||23.36|| तमस्यूर्ध्वगतश्रोतो ह्यक्षिपक्ष्मासमाश्रिता ॥२३:३६
36c °gataśroto C94K82; °gate śrotro E 36d hy akṣi° C94K82; hy ākṣi° E
tamaḥ pravartate jantos tatas tv akṣnor nimīlanam | तमः प्रवर्तते जन्तोस्ततस्त्वक्ष्नोर्निमीलनम् ।
37ab jantos tata° C94K82; janto tama° E 37b tv akṣṇor ni° C94; tv akṣṇo ni° K82E
nāsākṣikarṇaśrotāṃsi prayujyante kaphena tu ||23.37|| नासाक्षिकर्णश्रोतांसि प्रयुज्यन्ते कफेन तु ॥२३:३७
37c °śrotāṃsi K82E; śrotā× C94 37d prayujyante kaphena K82E; ×××××phena C94
hṛdayaṃ muhyate cāpi tamasā cāvṛtaṃ manaḥ | हृदयं मुह्यते चापि तमसा चावृतं मनः ।
sparśaṃ na vedayaty eva na śṛṇoti na paśyati ||23.38|| स्पर्शं न वेदयत्येव न शृणोति न पश्यति ॥२३:३८
nocchvāsayati nāsābhyāṃ vivṛtākṣimukho naraḥ | नोच्छ्वासयति नासाभ्यां विवृताक्षिमुखो नरः ।
39b °mukho naraḥ C94K82; °mukhena ca E
eṣā nṛṇām antakarī nidrā vai tāmasī smṛtā ||23.39|| एषा नृणामन्तकरी निद्रा वै तामसी स्मृता ॥२३:३९
39c °ntakarī K82E; °nakarī C94
akarmaṇy apravṛttiś ca mṛtavat svapate kṣitau | अकर्मण्यप्रवृत्तिश्च मृतवत्स्वपते क्षितौ ।
nidrotpattiṃ vikāraṃ ca kathito 'smi narādhipa | निद्रोत्पत्तिं विकारं च कथितो ऽस्मि नराधिप ।
40a °tpattiṃ vikāraṃ ca K82; °tpattiṃ vikāraś ca E, °tpatti×××× C94
tasmān nidrāṃ na seveta tamomohapravardhanīm ||23.40|| तस्मान्निद्रां न सेवेत तमोमोहप्रवर्धनीम् ॥२३:४०
40d °vardhanīm C94; °vardhanī K82E
iti vṛṣasārasaṃgrahe nidrotpattis trayoviṃśatimo 'dhyāyaḥ इति वृषसारसंग्रहे निद्रोत्पत्तिस्त्रयोविंशतिमो ऽध्यायः
Colophon: °viṃśatimo C94K82; °viṃśatitamo E



24 śāstravarṇanam
janamejaya uvāca | जनमेजय उवाच ।
devānāṃ dānavānāṃ ca vaiṣamyāni śrutāni me | देवानां दानवानां च वैषम्यानि श्रुतानि मे ।
1b vaiṣamyāni eme.; vaiśamyāni C94E • me C94; vai E
nidrāsambhavam āścaryaṃ tvatprasādena veditam ||24.1|| निद्रासम्भवमाश्चर्यं त्वत्प्रसादेन वेदितम् ॥२४:१
1d tvatprasādena veditam E; tvatpra* tam C94
trailokyavistarāyāmaṃ śrotum icchāmi bho dvija | त्रैलोक्यविस्तरायामं श्रोतुमिच्छामि भो द्विज ।
2a °lokya° C94; °lokyā° E 2b bho C94; vai E
kasmiṃścin narake jñeyaṃ pātālaṃ ca dvijottama ||24.2|| कस्मिंश्चिन्नरके ज्ञेयं पातालं च द्विजोत्तम ॥२४:२
2c kasmiṃścin narake C94; kasmiścin narakaṃ E
saptadvīpaṃ samicchāmi saptasāgaram eva ca | सप्तद्वीपं समिच्छामि सप्तसागरमेव च ।
merumūrdhaṃ ca viprendra devālayaṃ nibodha mām ||24.3|| मेरुमूर्धं च विप्रेन्द्र देवालयं निबोध माम् ॥२४:३
3c °mūrdhaṃ C94; °mūrdhaś E 3d devālayaṃ corr.; devālaya C94E
vaiśampāyana uvāca | वैशम्पायन उवाच ।
śṛṇu saṃkṣepato rājan trailokyāyāmavistaram | शृणु संक्षेपतो राजन्त्रैलोक्यायामविस्तरम् ।
4b °vistaram E; ××× C94
kālāgniḥ prathamo jñeyaḥ sarvādhastān nareśvara ||24.4|| कालाग्निः प्रथमो ज्ञेयः सर्वाधस्तान्नरेश्वर ॥२४:४
tasyopari nṛpaśreṣtha jñeyā narakakoṭayaḥ | तस्योपरि नृपश्रेष्थ ज्ञेया नरककोटयः ।
rauravādi avīcyantaṃ yātanāsthānam ucyate ||24.5|| रौरवादि अवीच्यन्तं यातनास्थानमुच्यते ॥२४:५
upariṣṭāt tu vijñeyāḥ pātālāḥ sapta eva tu | उपरिष्टात्तु विज्ञेयाः पातालाः सप्त एव तु ।
sapta pātālāḥ
ābhāsatālaḥ prathamaḥ svatālaś ca tataḥ param ||24.6|| आभासतालः प्रथमः स्वतालश्च ततः परम् ॥२४:६
6d svatālaś E; svalālañ C94ac, svatālañ C94pc
śītalaś ca gabhastiś ca śarkaraś ca śilātalam | शीतलश्च गभस्तिश्च शर्करश्च शिलातलम् ।
7b śarkaraś ca śilātalam eme.; ×××××lātalam C94, śarkaraś ca śilāvṛtam E
saptamaṃ tu mahātālaṃ śeṣanāgakṛtālayaḥ ||24.7|| सप्तमं तु महातालं शेषनागकृतालयः ॥२४:७
7c saptamaṃ C94; saptamas E
baliś ca daityarājendro rākṣasaś ca viśaṃkhaṇaḥ | बलिश्च दैत्यराजेन्द्रो राक्षसश्च विशंखणः ।
8b viśaṃkhaṇaḥ E; visaṃśanaḥ C94
ity evam ādayas sarve nāgadānavarākṣasāḥ ||24.8|| इत्येवमादयस्सर्वे नागदानवराक्षसाः ॥२४:८
sapta dvīpāḥ
sapta dvīpās tato jñeyāḥ saptasāgarasaṃvṛtāḥ | सप्त द्वीपास्ततो ज्ञेयाः सप्तसागरसंवृताः ।
priyavratasya putro 'bhūd daśarājaparākramaḥ ||24.9|| प्रियव्रतस्य पुत्रो ऽभूद्दशराजपराक्रमः ॥२४:९
9 omitted in E
agninvraścāgnivā dhātithir vasuḥ | अग्निन्व्रश्चाग्निवा धातिथिर्वसुः ।
10ab omitted in E
jyotismān dyutimān havyaḥ savanaḥ patra eva ca ||24.10|| ज्योतिस्मान्द्युतिमान्हव्यः सवनः पत्र एव च ॥२४:१०
agnibāhuś ca medhā ca patraś caiva trayo janāḥ | अग्निबाहुश्च मेधा च पत्रश्चैव त्रयो जनाः ।
saṃsārabhayabhītena mokṣamārgasamāśritāḥ ||24.11|| संसारभयभीतेन मोक्षमार्गसमाश्रिताः ॥२४:११
11d °mārga° E; °mārgaṃ C94
agnindhaṃ prathamadvīpe abhyaṣiñcan priyavrataḥ | अग्निन्धं प्रथमद्वीपे अभ्यषिञ्चन्प्रियव्रतः ।
12a agnindhaṃ E; agnindhraṃ C94 • prathama° E; prathamaṃ C94 12b abhyaṣiñcan C94; abhyaṣiñcata E
plakṣadvīpeśvaraṃ cakre nāmnā medhātithiṃ tathā ||24.12|| प्लक्षद्वीपेश्वरं चक्रे नाम्ना मेधातिथिं तथा ॥२४:१२
vasuṃ ca śālālī dvīpe abhiṣikto mahīpatiḥ | वसुं च शालाली द्वीपे अभिषिक्तो महीपतिः ।
13a vasuṃ ca śālālī E; ×××××× C94
jyotismantaṃ kuśadvīpe rājānam abhiṣecayet ||24.13|| ज्योतिस्मन्तं कुशद्वीपे राजानमभिषेचयेत् ॥२४:१३
krauñcadvīpeśvaraṃ cakre dyutimantaṃ nareśvara | क्रौञ्चद्वीपेश्वरं चक्रे द्युतिमन्तं नरेश्वर ।
14b nareśvara C94; nareśvaraḥ E
śākadvīpeśvaraṃ havyaṃ puṣkare savana smṛtaḥ ||24.14|| शाकद्वीपेश्वरं हव्यं पुष्करे सवन स्मृतः ॥२४:१४
madhye puṣkaradvīpasya parvato mānasottaraḥ | मध्ये पुष्करद्वीपस्य पर्वतो मानसोत्तरः ।
lokapālāḥ sthitās tatra caturbhiś caturo diśaḥ ||24.15|| लोकपालाः स्थितास्तत्र चतुर्भिश्चतुरो दिशः ॥२४:१५
15d caturo diśaḥ E; ××××× C94
mahāvītaḥ smṛto varṣo dhātakī ca narādhipa | महावीतः स्मृतो वर्षो धातकी च नराधिप ।
16a mahāvītaḥ C94; mahānītaḥ E
tasya bāhyaḥ samudro 'bhūt svādūdaka iti smṛtaḥ | तस्य बाह्यः समुद्रो ऽभूत्स्वादूदक इति स्मृतः ।
catuṣaṣṭi smṛto loko yojanānāṃ narādhipa ||24.16|| चतुषष्टि स्मृतो लोको योजनानां नराधिप ॥२४:१६
16 omitted in E
puṣkaradvīpam antaś ca kṣīrodo nāma sāgaraḥ | | पुष्करद्वीपमन्तश्च क्षीरोदो नाम सागरः ॥२४:१६
dvātriṃśallakṣavistāraḥ śākadvīpavahavṛṇaḥ | द्वात्रिंशल्लक्षविस्तारः शाकद्वीपवहवृणः ।
17a °vistāraḥ C94; °vistāraiḥ E 17b °vṛṇaḥ C94; °vṛṇe E
jaladaś ca kumāraś ca sukumāramaṇīcakaḥ ||24.17|| जलदश्च कुमारश्च सुकुमारमणीचकः ॥२४:१७
17cd kumāraś ca sukumāramaṇīcakaḥ E; kumā*××××**ṇīcakaḥ C94
kusumottaramodaś ca saptamaṃ ca mahādrumam | | कुसुमोत्तरमोदश्च सप्तमं च महाद्रुमम् ॥२४:१७
18d saptamaṃ C94; saptamaś E
havyaputrāḥ smṛtāḥ sapta varṣanāma tathā smṛtaḥ | हव्यपुत्राः स्मृताः सप्त वर्षनाम तथा स्मृतः ।
dvīpāntaṃ dadhimaṇḍādi kṣīrodārdhaṃ vinirdiśet ||24.18|| द्वीपान्तं दधिमण्डादि क्षीरोदार्धं विनिर्दिशेत् ॥२४:१८
18d vinirdiśet C94; nirdiśet E
krauñcadvīpasamudrānte sapta varṣās tu te smṛtāḥ | क्रौञ्चद्वीपसमुद्रान्ते सप्त वर्षास्तु ते स्मृताः ।
19a °dvīpa° C94; °dvīpe E 19b varṣās C94; varṣan E
kuśalomnonugaś coṣṇaḥ yavanaś cāndhakārakaḥ ||24.19|| कुशलोम्नोनुगश्चोष्णः यवनश्चान्धकारकः ॥२४:१९
19c kuśalomnonugaś coṣṇaḥ E; kuśalo manonugaś coṣṇaḥ C94 19d yavanaś cāndhakārakaḥ E; yāvanaś cā*××× C94
muniś ca dundubhiś caiva sutādyutimatas tu vai | मुनिश्च दुन्दुभिश्चैव सुताद्युतिमतस्तु वै ।
20b sutādyutimatas C94; sutadyutimanas E
dadhyardhe dhṛtamaṇḍodaḥ kuśadvīpaḥ samāvṛtaḥ ||24.20|| दध्यर्धे धृतमण्डोदः कुशद्वीपः समावृतः ॥२४:२०
tatrāpi saptavarṣaṃ ca nāmataḥ śṛṇu bhārata | तत्रापि सप्तवर्षं च नामतः शृणु भारत ।
21a °varṣe C94; °varṣaṃ E
udbhimāndheṇumāś caiva svairannālambano dhṛtiḥ ||24.21|| उद्भिमान्धेणुमाश्चैव स्वैरन्नालम्बनो धृतिः ॥२४:२१
21c °ṇumāś C94; °nusāś E 21d svaira° C94; svairā° E
ṣaṣṭaḥ prabhākaraś caiva kapilaḥ saptamaḥ smṛtaḥ | षष्टः प्रभाकरश्चैव कपिलः सप्तमः स्मृतः ।
ghṛtamaṇḍotadardhena tasyāntemadirodadhiḥ ||24.22|| घृतमण्डोतदर्धेन तस्यान्तेमदिरोदधिः ॥२४:२२
22c °tadardhena C94; °tardhena E 22d tasyāntemadiro° E; ta×××diro° C94
samantāc chālmalīdvīpo varṣāḥ saptaiva kīrtitāḥ | समन्ताच्छाल्मलीद्वीपो वर्षाः सप्तैव कीर्तिताः ।
23b varṣāḥ E; varṣoḥ C94
śvetaś ca haritaś caiva jīmūto rohitas tathā ||24.23|| श्वेतश्च हरितश्चैव जीमूतो रोहितस्तथा ॥२४:२३
23d rohitas C94; lohitas E
vaidyuto mānasaś caiva suprabhaḥ saptamaḥ smṛtaḥ | वैद्युतो मानसश्चैव सुप्रभः सप्तमः स्मृतः ।
madirodadhito 'rdhena jñeyas tvikṣurasodadhiḥ ||24.24|| मदिरोदधितो ऽर्धेन ज्ञेयस्त्विक्षुरसोदधिः ॥२४:२४
24c dadhito C94; °dadhino E 24d jñeyas C94; jñeya E
plakṣadvīpo vṛtas tena saptavarṣasamanvitaḥ | प्लक्षद्वीपो वृतस्तेन सप्तवर्षसमन्वितः ।
śāntaś ca śiśiraś caiva sukhadānanda eva ca ||24.25|| शान्तश्च शिशिरश्चैव सुखदानन्द एव च ॥२४:२५
25c śāntaś ca śiśiraś E; ×××××raś C94
śivakṣemo dhruvaś caiva saptamedhātitheḥ sutāḥ | शिवक्षेमो ध्रुवश्चैव सप्तमेधातिथेः सुताः ।
26a śiva° C94; śivaśiva° E
lavaṇodas tu tasyānte jambūdvīpasamāvṛtaḥ ||24.26|| लवणोदस्तु तस्यान्ते जम्बूद्वीपसमावृतः ॥२४:२६
26c °das tu tasyānte C94; °dadhisyānte E 26d °dvīpa° C94; °dvīpā° E
lakṣayojanavistāra upadvīpasamanvitaḥ | लक्षयोजनविस्तार उपद्वीपसमन्वितः ।
27a °vistāra C94; °vistāro E 27b °dvīpa° C94; °dvipa° E
aṅgadvīpo yavadvīpo malayadvīpa eva ca ||24.27|| अङ्गद्वीपो यवद्वीपो मलयद्वीप एव च ॥२४:२७
śaṅkhadvīpakamudvīpo varāhadvīpa eva ca | शङ्खद्वीपकमुद्वीपो वराहद्वीप एव च ।
siṃhabarhiṇadvīpaṃ ca padmacakras tathaiva ca ||24.28|| सिंहबर्हिणद्वीपं च पद्मचक्रस्तथैव च ॥२४:२८
vajraratnākaradvīpo haṃsakaḥ kumudas tathā | वज्ररत्नाकरद्वीपो हंसकः कुमुदस्तथा ।
lāṅgalo vṛṣadvīpaś ca dvīpo bhadrākaras tathā ||24.29|| लाङ्गलो वृषद्वीपश्च द्वीपो भद्राकरस्तथा ॥२४:२९
candradvīpaś ca sindhuś ca nandanadvīpa eva ca | चन्द्रद्वीपश्च सिन्धुश्च नन्दनद्वीप एव च ।
upadvīpasahasrāṇi evamādīni kīrtitam ||24.30|| उपद्वीपसहस्राणि एवमादीनि कीर्तितम् ॥२४:३०
agnīndho navavarṣeṣu navaputrān abhiṣiñcayat | अग्नीन्धो नववर्षेषु नवपुत्रानभिषिञ्चयत् ।
nābhiḥ kiṃpuruṣaś caiva harivarṣa ilāvṛtaḥ ||24.31|| नाभिः किंपुरुषश्चैव हरिवर्ष इलावृतः ॥२४:३१
atrāpi navabhedo 'bhūd bhāratātmajasambhavaḥ | अत्रापि नवभेदो ऽभूद्भारतात्मजसम्भवः ।
indradvīpakaśeruś ca tāmravarṇo gabhastimān ||24.32|| इन्द्रद्वीपकशेरुश्च ताम्रवर्णो गभस्तिमान् ॥२४:३२
nāgadvīpas tathā saumyo gandharvaś cātha vāruṇaḥ | नागद्वीपस्तथा सौम्यो गन्धर्वश्चाथ वारुणः ।
ayaṃ ca navamo dvīpaḥ kumārīdvīpasaṃjñitaḥ ||24.33|| अयं च नवमो द्वीपः कुमारीद्वीपसंज्ञितः ॥२४:३३
dakṣiṇe hemakūṭasya varṣaḥ kiṃpuruṣaḥ smṛtaḥ | दक्षिणे हेमकूटस्य वर्षः किंपुरुषः स्मृतः ।
niṣadho dakṣiṇapārśve harivarṣa iti smṛtaḥ ||24.34|| निषधो दक्षिणपार्श्वे हरिवर्ष इति स्मृतः ॥२४:३४
merumūle tu rājendra jñeyo varṣa ilāvṛtaḥ | मेरुमूले तु राजेन्द्र ज्ञेयो वर्ष इलावृतः ।
uttaraṇeṇa (uttareṇa?) tu nīlasya varṣa ramyaka ucyate ||24.35|| उत्तरणेण (उत्तरेण?) तु नीलस्य वर्ष रम्यक उच्यते ॥२४:३५
śveta-uttarato jñeyo varṣaramyahiraṇmayaḥ | श्वेत-उत्तरतो ज्ञेयो वर्षरम्यहिरण्मयः ।
tasya uttarato jñeyas triśṛṅgavaraparvataḥ ||24.36|| तस्य उत्तरतो ज्ञेयस्त्रिशृङ्गवरपर्वतः ॥२४:३६
tasya cottarapārśve tu varṣaḥ kuruvale smṛtaḥ | तस्य चोत्तरपार्श्वे तु वर्षः कुरुवले स्मृतः ।
pūrvaṃ bhadrāśvato jñeyaḥ ketumālas tu paścime ||24.37|| पूर्वं भद्राश्वतो ज्ञेयः केतुमालस्तु पश्चिमे ॥२४:३७
himaṃvān hemakūṭaś ca niṣadho nīla eva ca | हिमंवान्हेमकूटश्च निषधो नील एव च ।
śvetaś ca śṛṅgavantaś ca ṣaḍ ete varṣaparvatāḥ ||24.38|| श्वेतश्च शृङ्गवन्तश्च षडेते वर्षपर्वताः ॥२४:३८
aśītinavatīlakṣaḥ - varṣaparvatam āyatam | अशीतिनवतीलक्षः - वर्षपर्वतमायतम् ।
himavān hemakūṭaś ca niṣadhaś ceti dakṣiṇa ||24.39|| हिमवान्हेमकूटश्च निषधश्चेति दक्षिण ॥२४:३९
śvetaś caivatriśṛṅgaś ca nīlaś caiva tathottare | श्वेतश्चैवत्रिशृङ्गश्च नीलश्चैव तथोत्तरे ।
niṣadho nīlamadhye tu meruḥ śailamanoramaḥ ||24.40|| निषधो नीलमध्ये तु मेरुः शैलमनोरमः ॥२४:४०
praviṣṭaṣoḍaśādhas tāṃ caturāśītim ucchṛtaḥ | प्रविष्टषोडशाधस्तां चतुराशीतिमुच्छृतः ।
yojanānāṃ sahasrāṇi dvātriṃśad ūrdha ! vistṛtaḥ ||24.41|| योजनानां सहस्राणि द्वात्रिंशदूर्ध ! विस्तृतः ॥२४:४१
brahmāmanovatī nāma pureva satimadhyame | ब्रह्मामनोवती नाम पुरेव सतिमध्यमे ।
devarājo 'marāvatyām agnis tejovatī pure ||24.42|| देवराजो ऽमरावत्यामग्निस्तेजोवती पुरे ॥२४:४२
yamaḥ saṃyamanī nāma nityaṃ vasati bhūpate | यमः संयमनी नाम नित्यं वसति भूपते ।
naiṛtir vasati nityaṃ ramye śuddhavatī pure ||24.43|| नैऋतिर्वसति नित्यं रम्ये शुद्धवती पुरे ॥२४:४३
varuṇo bhogavatyāṃ tu vāyor gandhavatī purī | वरुणो भोगवत्यां तु वायोर्गन्धवती पुरी ।
mahodayāpurī ramyā somasyālayaraṃ smṛtam ||24.44|| महोदयापुरी रम्या सोमस्यालयरं स्मृतम् ॥२४:४४
yaśovatī purī ramyānnityam āste triśūlinaḥ | यशोवती पुरी रम्यान्नित्यमास्ते त्रिशूलिनः ।
tatragaṅgā catuḥbhinnā nipatantī mahītale ||24.45|| तत्रगङ्गा चतुःभिन्ना निपतन्ती महीतले ॥२४:४५
uttare paścime caiva pūrvadakṣiṇatas tathā | उत्तरे पश्चिमे चैव पूर्वदक्षिणतस्तथा ।
pūrvaṃ gaṅgā sravatyāccālakānandā ca dakṣiṇe ||24.46|| पूर्वं गङ्गा स्रवत्याच्चालकानन्दा च दक्षिणे ॥२४:४६
śītā paścimagā gaṅgā bhadrasomā tathottare | शीता पश्चिमगा गङ्गा भद्रसोमा तथोत्तरे ।
ṣaṣṭiyojanasāhasraṃ nirālambā nipatya ca ||24.47|| षष्टियोजनसाहस्रं निरालम्बा निपत्य च ॥२४:४७
bhadrāśvaṃ plāvayitvā tu vanāny upavanāni ca | भद्राश्वं प्लावयित्वा तु वनान्युपवनानि च ।
droṇasthalī girīṇāṃ ca atikramyārṇavaṃ gatā ||24.48|| द्रोणस्थली गिरीणां च अतिक्रम्यार्णवं गता ॥२४:४८
tathaivālakanandā ca gatāśailenanimnagā | तथैवालकनन्दा च गताशैलेननिम्नगा ।
gaṅgā bhāratavarṣaṃ ca praviṣṭālavaṇo dadhim ||24.49|| गङ्गा भारतवर्षं च प्रविष्टालवणो दधिम् ॥२४:४९
plāvayitvā sthalīn sarvān mānuṣākaluṣāpahā | प्लावयित्वा स्थलीन्सर्वान्मानुषाकलुषापहा ।
paścimena gatāgaṅgā sītānāmā ca bhārataḥ ||24.50|| पश्चिमेन गतागङ्गा सीतानामा च भारतः ॥२४:५०
plāvayet ketumālāṃ ca kṣetraśaivavanasthalīm | प्लावयेत्केतुमालां च क्षेत्रशैववनस्थलीम् ।
atikramyārṇavagatā sthalīdroṇī ca nimnagā ||24.51|| अतिक्रम्यार्णवगता स्थलीद्रोणी च निम्नगा ॥२४:५१
bhadrasomanadīty evaṃ plāvayitvottaraṃ kurun | भद्रसोमनदीत्येवं प्लावयित्वोत्तरं कुरुन् ।
sthalī prasravaṇadroṇīm atikramyārṇavaṃ gatā ||24.52|| स्थली प्रस्रवणद्रोणीमतिक्रम्यार्णवं गता ॥२४:५२
mero vai dakṣiṇe pārśve jambūvṛkṣaḥ sanātanaḥ | मेरो वै दक्षिणे पार्श्वे जम्बूवृक्षः सनातनः ।
tena nāmāṅkito rājan jambūdvīpa iti śrutam ||24.53|| तेन नामाङ्कितो राजन्जम्बूद्वीप इति श्रुतम् ॥२४:५३
koṭīṣoḍaśabhiś caiva ayutāni trayodaśa | कोटीषोडशभिश्चैव अयुतानि त्रयोदश ।
adhordhayāma rājendra kṣityāvaraṇam antataḥ ||24.54|| अधोर्धयाम राजेन्द्र क्षित्यावरणमन्ततः ॥२४:५४
navalakṣādhikaṃ rājan pañcakoṭī mahī smṛtā | नवलक्षाधिकं राजन्पञ्चकोटी मही स्मृता ।
yojanānāṃ tu vijñeyaḥ pṛthivyāyām avistarāt ||24.55|| योजनानां तु विज्ञेयः पृथिव्यायामविस्तरात् ॥२४:५५
svādūdakasya ca bahir lokāloko mahāgiriḥ | स्वादूदकस्य च बहिर्लोकालोको महागिरिः ।
kañcanidviguṇābhūmi tasmād giribahi smṛtaḥ ||24.56|| कञ्चनिद्विगुणाभूमि तस्माद्गिरिबहि स्मृतः ॥२४:५६
tasmād bāhyaḥ samudro bhūd garbhādeti samudrarāṭ | तस्माद्बाह्यः समुद्रो भूद्गर्भादेति समुद्रराट् ।
aṣṭāviṃśatikaṃ lakṣaṃ śatalakṣāṇi vistaram ||24.57|| अष्टाविंशतिकं लक्षं शतलक्षाणि विस्तरम् ॥२४:५७
etad bhūrlokavistāro hy ata ūrdhvabhuvaḥ smṛtaḥ | एतद्भूर्लोकविस्तारो ह्यत ऊर्ध्वभुवः स्मृतः ।
svarlokāsyapareṇaiva maharlokam ataḥ param ||24.58|| स्वर्लोकास्यपरेणैव महर्लोकमतः परम् ॥२४:५८
janalokas tapaḥ satyaṃ kramaśaḥ parikīrtitam | जनलोकस्तपः सत्यं क्रमशः परिकीर्तितम् ।
brahmalokaḥ smṛtaḥ satyaṃ viṣṇulokam ataḥ param ||24.59|| ब्रह्मलोकः स्मृतः सत्यं विष्णुलोकमतः परम् ॥२४:५९
tasmāt pareṇa bodhavyaṃ divyadhyānapuraṃ mahat | तस्मात्परेण बोधव्यं दिव्यध्यानपुरं महत् ।
sahasrabhaumaprāsādaṃ vaidūryamaṇitoraṇam ||24.60|| सहस्रभौमप्रासादं वैदूर्यमणितोरणम् ॥२४:६०
nānāratnavicitrāṇi nānābhūtagaṇākulam | नानारत्नविचित्राणि नानाभूतगणाकुलम् ।
sarvakāmasamṛddhāni pūrṇaṃ tatra manoharaiḥ ||24.61|| सर्वकामसमृद्धानि पूर्णं तत्र मनोहरैः ॥२४:६१
tatra siṃhādane divye sarvaratnavibhūṣite | तत्र सिंहादने दिव्ये सर्वरत्नविभूषिते ।
tatrāste bhagavān rudraḥ somāṅkitajaṭādharaḥ ||24.62|| तत्रास्ते भगवान्रुद्रः सोमाङ्कितजटाधरः ॥२४:६२
tryakṣatribhuvanaśreṣṭas triśūlī tridaśādhipaḥ | त्र्यक्षत्रिभुवनश्रेष्टस्त्रिशूली त्रिदशाधिपः ।
devyā saha mahābhāgo gaṇaiś ca parivāritaḥ ||24.63|| देव्या सह महाभागो गणैश्च परिवारितः ॥२४:६३
skandanandipurogaś ca gaṇakoṭiśatākulaḥ | स्कन्दनन्दिपुरोगश्च गणकोटिशताकुलः ।
anekarudrakanyābhirūpiṇībhir alaṅkitaḥ ||24.64|| अनेकरुद्रकन्याभिरूपिणीभिरलङ्कितः ॥२४:६४
64c °kanyābhi° corr.; °kanyabhi° E
tatra puṇyanadī sapta sarvapāpāpanodanī | तत्र पुण्यनदी सप्त सर्वपापापनोदनी ।
suvarṇavālukādivyā ratnapāṣāṇaśobhitā ||24.65|| सुवर्णवालुकादिव्या रत्नपाषाणशोभिता ॥२४:६५
pāvanī ca vareṇyā ca varārhāvaradā varā | पावनी च वरेण्या च वरार्हावरदा वरा ।
vareśāvarabhadrā ca suprasannā jalāśivā ||24.66|| वरेशावरभद्रा च सुप्रसन्ना जलाशिवा ॥२४:६६
anekakusumārāmā ratnapuṣpaphaladrumāḥ | अनेककुसुमारामा रत्नपुष्पफलद्रुमाः ।
anekaratnaprākārā yojanāyutam ucchritāḥ ||24.67|| अनेकरत्नप्राकारा योजनायुतमुच्छ्रिताः ॥२४:६७
ahiṃsāsatyaniratāḥ kāmakrodhavivarjitāḥ | अहिंसासत्यनिरताः कामक्रोधविवर्जिताः ।
dhyānayogaratānityaṃ tatra modanti te narāḥ ||24.68|| ध्यानयोगरतानित्यं तत्र मोदन्ति ते नराः ॥२४:६८
tatra gomātaras sarvā nivasanti yatavratāḥ | तत्र गोमातरस्सर्वा निवसन्ति यतव्रताः ।
golokaḥ śivalokaś ca eka eva vidhīyate ||24.69|| गोलोकः शिवलोकश्च एक एव विधीयते ॥२४:६९
tasmād ūrdhaṃ paraṃ jñeyaṃ sthānatrayam anuttamam | तस्मादूर्धं परं ज्ञेयं स्थानत्रयमनुत्तमम् ।
kandagaurī maheśānaṃ nityaśuddhaṃ paraṃ śivam ||24.70|| कन्दगौरी महेशानं नित्यशुद्धं परं शिवम् ॥२४:७०
dinakṛt koṭisaṅkāsam anopamyaṃ sanātanam | दिनकृत्कोटिसङ्कासमनोपम्यं सनातनम् ।
ādityāda ! śivāntaś ca dvistheṇordhvakramaiḥ mṛstaḥ (smṛtaḥ) ||24.71|| आदित्याद ! शिवान्तश्च द्विस्थेणोर्ध्वक्रमैः मृस्तः (स्मृतः) ॥२४:७१
abhyantare tat kathito 'dya sāraṃ अभ्यन्तरे तत्कथितो ऽद्य सारं
72a abhyantare tat ka° C94; atyantaretka° E
     kim anya rājan kathayāmi sāram |     किमन्य राजन्कथयामि सारम् ।
jñānārṇavaṃ kīrtita dharmasāram ज्ञानार्णवं कीर्तित धर्मसारम्
72c jñānārṇavaṃ kīrtita dharmasāram E; jñānārṇṇaṅkīrti××××× C94
     purāṇavedopaniṣatsusāram ||24.72||     पुराणवेदोपनिषत्सुसारम् ॥२४:७२
yathā hi rājā parivāramadhye यथा हि राजा परिवारमध्ये
73a °vāra° C94; °cāra° E
     yathāntavartī bahivartin eva |     यथान्तवर्ती बहिवर्तिनेव ।
73b yathāntava° E; yathāntarvva C94 • °vartin eva E; varttineva C94
bhuñjanti bhogān satatāntavartī भुञ्जन्ति भोगान्सततान्तवर्ती
73c bhuñjanti bhogān E; bhuñja ××× C94
     kleśādhikaṃ nitya bahiḥsthitānām ||24.73||     क्लेशाधिकं नित्य बहिःस्थितानाम् ॥२४:७३
yathaiva rājā kariṇo ntardantam यथैव राजा करिणो न्तर्दन्तम्
74a kariṇo ntardantam C94; kariṇāntadantadattam E
     bhuñjanti bhogān satataṃ narendra |     भुञ्जन्ति भोगान्सततं नरेन्द्र ।
74b bhuñjanti E; bhujanti C94
yudhyeta rājā bahirdantabhogair युध्येत राजा बहिर्दन्तभोगैर्
74c bahirdantabhogair C94; bahidattabhogair E
     yadantare paśya samānajātam ||24.74||     यदन्तरे पश्य समानजातम् ॥२४:७४
74d yadantare paśya samānajātam E; yadantare ××××najātam C94
na dānatulyaṃ tv abhayapradasya न दानतुल्यं त्वभयप्रदस्य
     na yajñatulyaṃ jita-indriyasya |     न यज्ञतुल्यं जित-इन्द्रियस्य ।
na cārthatulyaṃ jitakāminaś ca न चार्थतुल्यं जितकामिनश्च
75c °kāminaś ca E; kāmina×× C94
     na dharmatulyaṃ damakāmitasya ||24.75||     न धर्मतुल्यं दमकामितस्य ॥२४:७५
75d na dharmatulyaṃ E; ××××× C94 • kāmitasya C94; kāminasya E
bahvantaraṃ naiva hi dharmayoś ca बह्वन्तरं नैव हि धर्मयोश्च
     kleśādhikaṃ bāhyaphalālpasāram |     क्लेशाधिकं बाह्यफलाल्पसारम् ।
yad atra dharmaṃ phalanaiṣṭhikasya यदत्र धर्मं फलनैष्ठिकस्य
     na tulyakoṭī śatayājināpi ||24.76||     न तुल्यकोटी शतयाजिनापि ॥२४:७६
etat pavitraṃ paramaṃ sadharmam एतत्पवित्रं परमं सधर्मम्
     purā yathoktaṃ parameśvareṇa |     पुरा यथोक्तं परमेश्वरेण ।
mayāpi tulyaṃ kathitaṃ yathāvat मयापि तुल्यं कथितं यथावत्
     purāṇavedopaniṣatsusāram ||24.77||     पुराणवेदोपनिषत्सुसारम् ॥२४:७७
sadojasaubhāgyam atīva medhā सदोजसौभाग्यमतीव मेधा
     nirutsukaḥ saumyam anuttamaṃ ca |     निरुत्सुकः सौम्यमनुत्तमं च ।
suputrapautraṃ na vichinnagotram सुपुत्रपौत्रं न विछिन्नगोत्रम्
     bhavanti vidyādharalokapūjyam ||24.78||     भवन्ति विद्याधरलोकपूज्यम् ॥२४:७८
yaśaśriyaṃ kīrtir atīva tejo यशश्रियं कीर्तिरतीव तेजो
     janapriyo dhānyadhanāyuvṛddhiḥ |     जनप्रियो धान्यधनायुवृद्धिः ।
prabodhaprajñārujadharmavṛddhim प्रबोधप्रज्ञारुजधर्मवृद्धिम्
     bhavanti te śāstrasadābhiyogī ||24.79||     भवन्ति ते शास्त्रसदाभियोगी ॥२४:७९
yaśasvinī āryasuvarṇaśṛṅgī यशस्विनी आर्यसुवर्णशृङ्गी
     vedāntavipradvijagāyaneṣu |     वेदान्तविप्रद्विजगायनेषु ।
dattvā phalaṃ tīrtham anuttameṣu दत्त्वा फलं तीर्थमनुत्तमेषु
     śṛṇvanti ye tasya bhavet sapuṇyam ||24.80||     शृण्वन्ति ये तस्य भवेत्सपुण्यम् ॥२४:८०
daśādhikaṃ vā ca catuś ca puṇyam दशाधिकं वा च चतुश्च पुण्यम्
     śatādhikaṃ yaḥ paṭhitaprabhāte |     शताधिकं यः पठितप्रभाते ।
sahasraśaḥ pustakṛtasya puṇyam सहस्रशः पुस्तकृतस्य पुण्यम्
     paro 'bhyaste kīrtaya te yutāni ||24.81||     परो ऽभ्यस्ते कीर्तय ते युतानि ॥२४:८१
adhītya yasyoragataṃ suśāstram अधीत्य यस्योरगतं सुशास्त्रम्
     samastamadhyāyam anukramena |     समस्तमध्यायमनुक्रमेन ।
daśāyutāṅgo dadatuś ca puṇyam दशायुताङ्गो ददतुश्च पुण्यम्
     labhaty asaṃdigdhayathādinaikaṃ ||24.82||     लभत्यसंदिग्धयथादिनैकं ॥२४:८२
yenedaṃ śāstrasāram avikalamanasā yo 'bhyaseta prayatnāt येनेदं शास्त्रसारमविकलमनसा यो ऽभ्यसेत प्रयत्नात्
83a bhyaseta pra° E; bhyaset tatpra° C94
     vyakto 'sau siddhayogī bhavati ca niyataṃ yas tu cittaprasannaḥ |     व्यक्तो ऽसौ सिद्धयोगी भवति च नियतं यस्तु चित्तप्रसन्नः ।
83b sau E; so C94
pitryaṃ yo gītapūrvaṃ pratidinaśataśo urddhi yante ca sarve पित्र्यं यो गीतपूर्वं प्रतिदिनशतशो उर्द्धि यन्ते च सर्वे
83c pitryaṃ yo gītapūrvaṃ C94; nitya yo dhītayota pūrvvaṃ E • °dinaśataśo urddhi yante ca sarve E; dina×××××××××× C94
     ātmānaṃ nirvikalpaṃ śivapadam asamaṃ prāpnuvantīha sarve ||24.83||     आत्मानं निर्विकल्पं शिवपदमसमं प्राप्नुवन्तीह सर्वे ॥२४:८३
iti vṛṣasārasaṃgrahe śāstravarṇanā nāma caturviṃśatitamo 'dhyāyaḥ इति वृषसारसंग्रहे शास्त्रवर्णना नाम चतुर्विंशतितमो ऽध्यायः
Colophon: °varṇanā C94; °varṇano E • dhyāyaḥ E; dhyāyaḥ samāptaḥ C94
vṛṣasārasaṃgrahaḥ samāpta iti वृषसारसंग्रहः समाप्त इति
vṛṣasārasaṃgrahaḥ samāpta iti C94; omitted in E
 
 
 
 

Translation



|1.1| The Compendium on the Essence of the Dharma Bull Chapter One Having bowed to [Him] who has no beginning, middle part and end, whose boundaries are limitless, who is very subtle and who is the unmanifest and fine essence of the world, who is ... [to be worshipped?] by Hari, Indra, Brahmā and the other [gods], I shall teach the Compendium on the Essence of the Bull.

|1.2| Having listened to the Bhāratasaṃhitā, the supreme book of 100,000 [verses], 1,000 chapters

|1.2| and a hundred sections, in its entirety,

|1.3| Janamejaya remained unsatisfied and what he asked Vaiśampāyana

|1.3| in the past, listen to that unwearied.

|1.3| Janamejaya spoke:

|1.4| O venerable sir, O knower of the entire Dharma, O you who are well-versed in all the Śāstras!

|1.4| Is there a supreme and secret Dharma which liberates [us] from the ocean of Saṃsāra?

|1.5| Tell me the Dharma that was uttered by Dvaipāyana, O best of Brahmins.

|1.5| Help me find satisfaction at all cost, O great ascetic!

|1.5| Vaiśampāyana spoke:

|1.6| Listen with great attention, O king, to this unsurpassed narration of Dharma.

|1.6| Hear the secret Dharma that I received by Vyāsa's favour.

|1.7| Viṣṇu, the great Lord, assumed the form of a Brahmin and to test him he humbly asked the one who performed immaterial sacrifices [i.e. Anarthayajña] a question, [Anarthayajña,] the one who was focused in his austerities and observances,

|1.7| and whose conduct was virtuous and pure, and who was intent on compassion towards all living beings.

|1.8| [Vigatarāga spoke:]

|1.9| How is the knowledge of Brahman to be known if it is devoid of form and colour?

|1.9| What[?] is the supreme[?] syllable which is devoid of vowels and consonants?

|1.9| Anarthayajña spoke:

|1.10| That supreme[?] syllable is not to be pronounced, is unquestionable, non-dividable, consistent,

|1.10| spotless, all-pervading and subtle.

|1.10| Vigatarāga spoke:

|1.11| When the body disintegrates in the ground, in water, in fire or [is torn apart] by jackals,

|1.11| how is the supportless and spotless soul led [to the other world] by Yama's messengers?

|1.12| How is it bound by the noose of time? And if it is bodiless, how can it move?

|1.12| And how does the [soul of a] virtuous [person] reach heaven if it has no body?

|1.12| These are my doubts, teach me! I want to know the truth.

|1.12| Anarthyajña spoke:

|1.13| Your doubts that you put to me are extremely problematic, O great Brahmin.

|1.13| It is difficult to understand by humans, and [even] by Devas, Dānavas and Serpents.

|1.13| Anarthayajña spoke:

|1.14| The cause of both the birth and death of the body is karma.

|1.14| Good and bad deeds are called the two nooses.

|1.15| [Man] goes to hell or heaven accordingly.

|1.15| Happiness and suffering, both arising from karma, are to be experienced by the body.

|1.16| O great Brahmin, the body is produced for humans for his reason.

|1.16| Now hear that which they call the noose of time, I shall teach you, O you of great observances.

|1.17| You don't know anything. How could you start your investigation [in this way], O Brahmin?

|1.17| O Brahmin king, you should know the noose of time in its entirety.

|1.18| Learn about time which is divided by digits and about the art of the truth of time.

|1.18| Two atomic spaces of time (truṭi) is one twinkling (nimeṣa). One digit [kalā] is twice a twinkling.

|1.19| Two digits is one Kāṣṭhā.?? One Kāṣṭhā is 30 digits.??

|1.19| 30 Kalās make up one Muhūrta according to mankind, O great Brahmin.

|1.20| 30 Muhūrtas are known to the wise as night and day [i.e. a full day].

|1.20| Thirty days and nights are taught by the wise ones to be one month.

|1.21| One year is twelve months, [say] those who know the truth about time.

|1.21| Three hundred thousand years[?] are ... ?

|1.22| The Kali era is said to be the time [span] of sixty thousand [years].

|1.22| The Dvāpara era is known to be twice [as long as] the Kali era.

|1.23| The Tretā era is thrice [as long], the Kṛta era four times [as long as the Kali].

|1.23| The number related to the four Yugas is seventy-one:

|1.24| [thus] the knowledge about one Manvantara is being taught briefly [i.e. 71 four-fold Mahāyugas is a Manvantara].

|1.24| One Kalpa is fourteen Manvantaras.

|1.25| Ten thousand Kalpas is Brahmā's day.

|1.25| [His] night is of the same [length] according to the wise who know the truth.

|1.26| When the night falls they dissolve, the whole moving and unmoving universe.

|1.26| And when daylight comes, the moving and unmoving [universe] is born.

|1.27| The past is para times parārdha [number of] kalpas [i.e. a hundred million billions (parārdha) times two million billions (para)], O great Brahmin.

|1.27| Bhṛgu and the other sages say that the future is the same [time span].

|1.28| Just as the sun, the planets, the stars[?] and the moon are seen as wandering around in this world,

|1.28| the wheel of time spins around and we never stop. ????

|1.29| Time creates living beings and time destroys them again.

|1.29| Everything is under the control of time. There is nothing that can bring time under control.

|1.30| Fourteen parārdha are the kings[?], O Brahmin,

|1.30| have been passed by time, for time is difficult to overcome.

|1.31| This is time as a great yogin, as Brahmā, Viṣṇu and supreme Śiva,

|1.31| beginningless and endless, the creator, the great soul. Pay homage [to Time].

|1.31| [The Parārdha etc.: divisions of time]

|1.31| Vigatarāga spoke:

|1.32| I have just heard [the term] `wheel of time' uttered from [your] lotus mouth,

|1.32| as well as `parārdha' and `para'. ....?

|1.32| Anarthayajña spoke:

|1.33| One, ten, a hundred, a thousand, and ten thousand,

|1.33| a hundred thousand[?] (prayuta), a million (niyuta), ten millions (koṭi), a hundred millions (arbuda), and a billion (vṛnda),

|1.34| 10 billions (kharva), 100 billions (nikharva), 1000 billions (śaṅku), and ten thousand billions (padma),

|1.34| 100 thousand billions (samudra), a million billions (madhya), ten million billions (anta), a hundred million billions (parārdha), and two million billions (para).

|1.35| All should be known as powers of ten up to Parārdha.

|1.35| The number corresponding to para is double the parārdha.

|1.36| There is no higher number than para. This is my conviction

|1.36| based on readings of the Purāṇas and the Vedas and [now] taught [to you], O great Brahmin.

|1.36| Vigatarāga spoke:

|1.37| How many eggs of Brahmā are there, and is its measure taught anywhere?

|1.37| ... ? the sun heats the earth.

|1.38| How could I enumerate all the eggs of Brahmā[?], O Brahmin?

|1.38| Even the gods don't know them [all], not to mention mortals.

|1.39| I shall teach [them to you] one by one, as far as I can, O great Brahmin,

|1.39| [that] which Brahmā taught in the past [to?] Mātariśvan, as it really is.

|1.40| Inside Śiva's egg.....

|1.40| The ten names [of cosmic rulers/worlds] associated with each of the ten directions in Brahmā's egg are being taught now, listen.

|1.41| ***[The ten names [of cosmic rulers/worlds] associated with each of the ten directions]***

|1.41| [1] Saha, [2] Asaha, [3] Sahas, [4] Sahya, [5] Visaha, [6] Saṃhata, [7] Sabhā,

|1.41| [8] Prasaha, [9] Aprasaha, [10] Sānu: [these are] the ten Leaders in the East.

|1.52| Each of the ten deities[?] has a retinue of a hundred times hundred [deities].

|1.52| Each one in [these groups of] a hundred is surrounded by a thousand.

|1.53| Each one in these [groups of] thousands is surrounded by ten thousand,

|1.53| by a hundred thousand, a million, a billion..... .

|1.54| Each one has a retinue of a Niyuta [members].

|1.60| Here about the measurments [of the universe] briefly, O Brahmin, from me, I shall teach [you].

|1.63| The Vedic redactors [of the Purāṇas]

|1.64| O true Brahmin, the 80,000,000 [?] Purāṇas

|1.64| were taught by [1] Brahmā to [2] Mātariśvan [= Vāyu] in their entirety, as they were.

|1.65| Vāyu abridged the verses and then gave [the Purāṇas] to [3] Uśanas.

|1.65| He [Uśanas] also abridged the verses, and [4] Bṛhaspati received them.

|1.66| Bṛhaspati taught 30,000 [verses] to [5] Sūrya [the Sun].

|1.66| Divākara [= the Sun] taught 25,000 [verses] to [6] Mṛtyu [Death].

|1.67| Death taught 21,000 [verses] to [7] Indra.

|1.67| Indra taught 20,000 verses to [8] Vasiṣṭha.

|1.68| And he[, Vasiṣṭha taught] 18,000 [verses] to [9] Sārasvata.

|1.68| Sārasvatas [taught] 17,000 [verses] to [10] Tridhāman.

|1.69| [Tridhāman] taught 16,000 verses to [11] Bharadvāja.

|1.69| [Bharadvāja] taught 15,000 verses to [12] Trivṛṣa.

|1.70| [Trivṛṣa] then [taught] 14,000 verses to [13] Antarīkṣa.

|1.70| [Antarīkṣa] taught 13,000 [verses] to [14] Trayyāruṇi.

|1.71| Trayyāruṇi, the great Brahmin, having abridged them again,

|1.71| taught 12,000 [verses] to [15] Dhanaṃjaya.

|1.72| Dhanaṃjaya, the great sage, handed [them] over to [16] Kṛtaṃjaya.

|1.72| [It was transmitted] from Kṛtaṃjaya, O great Brahmin, to [17] noble Ṛṇaṃjaya.

|1.73| Then from Ṛṇaṃjaya it was given to [18] Gautama, the great sage,

|1.73| from Gautama to [19??] Bharadvāja[?], from him to [19/20] Dharmadvata.

|1.74| Then [20/21] Rājaśravas received it, then [21/22] Somaśuṣma.

|1.74| Then from Somaśuṣma, [22/23] Tṛṇabindu received it, O Brahmin.

|1.75| Tṛṇabindu taught it to [23/24] Vṛkṣa, Vṛkṣa to [24/25] Śakti [the fater of Parāśara].

|1.75| Śakti taught it to [25/26] Parāśara, then [Parāśara] to [26/27] Jātūkarṇa.

|1.76| Jātukarṇa taught it to [27/28] Dvaipāyana, the great sage.

|1.76| Dvaipāyana, the great sage, gave it to [28/29] Romaharṣa.

|1.77| He [Dvaipāyana] taught it to Romaharṣa, his brilliant son.

|1.77| 12,000 Purāṇa [verses?] have been revealed

|1.77| for the benefit of humankind. What else do you wish to know?

|1.77| Here ends the first chapter in the Vṛṣasārasaṃgraha called the enumeration of the Brahmāṇḍa[s?].

|2.1| Vigatarāga spoke: I, the Brahmin(? phps accept it) [rather: through you, a Brahmin], have listened to the concise description of the Brahmāṇḍa, it's extent, colour, form and the numbers associated with it.

|2.2| You mentioned the Śivāṇḍa as taught to be the receptacle of the Brahmāṇḍa [see 1.40ab]. What are its characteristics and how much is its extent?

|2.3| Whose dwelling/resting place is it [phps ālayana for ālaya] and [what] is the extent/proof of the one who dwells there? [maybe the number of inhabitants Flo] [Or: what is its extent and [who are its] inhabitants]? Who are the people there? And who is Prajāpati there?

|2.4| Anarthayajña spoke: Please don't ask me about the characteristics of the Śivāṇḍa, O Brahmin. How could even the gods have the power to really know and see...

|2.5| ...the path to the unattainable place which is extremely secret and [...] There is no master or the opposite there, nobody to be punished and no punisher.

|2.6| There are no truthful or untruthful people there, no moral or immoral people, no wicked people, no hypocrisy, no thirst or envy.

|2.7| There is no anger or desire, no arrogance or discontent ([a]sūyaka). No envy or hatred, no cheaters and no jealousy.

|2.8| There is no disease, no aging, no grief and no agitation there. There are no inferior people or superior people and there is nobody in-between.

|2.9| There are no privileged men or women there in Śiva's abode, no reproach or praise, no selfish or treacherous people.

|2.10| There is no pride or arrogance there, no cruelty or trickery and so on. There are no beggars and no donors there.

|2.11| Go without desires, being there you'll be resting under a wishing tree. There is no karma there and no enemy. The era of strife [the Kali era] is not there and there is no fight.

|2.12| There is no Dvāpara era or Tretā or Kṛta. There are no Manvantaras (1 Manvantara = 1000 Kalpas) there and no Kalpas.

|2.13| No universal floods come, and there are no days and nights of Brahmā. There is no birth and death there and one never encounters catastrophes.

|2.14| Nobody is tied to noose of hope and there is no passion or delusion. There are no gods and demons there and no Yakṣas, Serpents and Rākṣasas.

|2.15| There are no Ghosts and Piśācas, no Gandharvas and Ṛṣis. There are no asterisms and planets there, no Nāgas, Kiṃnaras or Garuḍa-like creatures.

|2.16| There is no recitation there or daily rituals, nobody performs the Agnihotra and there is no sacrificer. There are no religious observances and no austerities and no 'animal hell'.

|2.17| Nobody would be able to tell the extent of the god Īśāna's[??] powers starting with aiśvarya, not even in a hundred years.

|2.18| [Instead] I'll teach you all that are produced by Hara's wish one by one, excluding the gods and people, starting with the trees, the bushes and creepers.

|2.19| [Their?] height is two Parārdha, and [their?] width is the same. There are lovely flowers of different forms and also lovely fruits.

|2.20| There are also golden trees and also gem trees, coral gem thickets and ruby plants.

|2.21| There are trees with twigs on which creepers with tasty roots reach for the tasty fruits. [REVISE] All of them can change their shapes on their own accord [just bending etc.?] and they fulfill man's desires and they whisper in a lovely way[?] [any language? maybe not].

|2.22| There [in the Śivāṇḍa], O Brahmin, all the subjects are the oceans of endless virtues. They are all equally beautiful and strong, and they shine like millions of suns.

|2.23| ... is two Parārdha [yojanas] long and two Parārdha [yojanas] wide, and two Parārdha yojanas is its extension[?], O great Brahmin.

|2.24| Authority is not a number [cannot be expressed by a number? OR: there is no question of....?] neither is the Power of strength, O Brahmin. Down and up are no numbers [no question of going to heaven or hell?], and nobody goes to the Tiryañc [hell] [??? OR with iti: there is no horizontal extension?].

|2.25| I do not know the length and width of the Śivāṇḍa. Enjoyment is undecaying there, and there is no birth or death there.

|2.26| Inside the Śivāṇḍa, there is the dwelling-place of Īśāna's people [= Īśāna's region] [on] one and a half Para krore [yojanas? or that many people?], who shine like cow's milk [or the region shines?].

|2.27| They are all like the rising sun in the House of Tatpuruṣa [on] one and a half Para krore [yojanas? or that many people?] in the east.

|2.28| All of them are like collyrium in the southern direction, in the House of Aghora, [on] one and a half Para krore [yojanas?].

|2.29| In the western direction, in Sadyojāta's beloved House, [on] one and a half krore [yojanas?] they are like jasmine, the moon, like snowy rocks.

|2.30| In the northern direction, in Vāmadeva's House of one and a half krore [yojanas?] they are like saffron and water.

|2.31| Īśāna has five parts (kalā), [his Tatpuruṣa] face has four. Aghora has eight, and there are thirteen Vāmadeva[-kalā]s.

|2.32| Sadyojāta has eight parts. These parts, altogether thirty-eight, which liberate us from the ocean of existence, have been taught, O truest Brahmin.

|2.33| Those who explore the Truth should know the numbers, the colours and directions associated with each one [of Śiva's faces] in the way taught above.

|2.34| If one has the intention to go to the Śivāṇḍa [if he is 'pulled' towards it], one should practise Śiva yoga regularly. Without Śiva yoga, O Brahmin, it is impossible to go there.

|2.35| [Even] by [performing] millions of sacrifices such as the Aśvamedha, or all the difficult austerities, for a hundred Kalpas, it is impossible to get there even for the gods, O great ascetic.

|2.36| [Only] by bathing and performing austerities at all the sacred places such as the Gaṅgā, even the honorable Ṛṣis will not be able to get there.

|2.37| Or by donating the oceans of the seven islands with all their gems to a Veda expert, O Brahmin, having faith and devotion, one will not be able to go there without meditation. [This is a] certainty.

|2.38| He who destroys his own body and gives it without hesitation to those who are in need of it, or gives his wife, his son and his possessions or his own head to those in need, or by [performing] other difficult deeds, will not be able to go there.

|2.39| He who has completed the sacrifices, the pilgrimages, the austerities, the donations, the study of the Vedas, will experience those enjoyments that the Brahmāṇḍa offers, still being subject to time and death.

|2.40| Dharma decays with time that is sent by... Like a circle of burning coal, time goes round and round. Time is called 'kāla' because of the waves (kalana) of the three divisions of time [past, present, future].

|2.40| Here ends the second chapter in the Vṛṣasārasaṃgraha called the enumeration of the Śivāṇḍa.

|3.6| Her beautiful wives, thirteen in number, had nice hips.

|3.7| They were Dakṣa's daughters, they had huge eyes, were rich in faith, and were charming. Numerous sons and grandsons were born to him. This is what the nature (nisarga) of Dharma is like. What more do you wish to hear?

|3.9| [1] Śraddhā, [2] Lakṣmī, [3] Dhṛti, [4] Tuṣṭi, [5] Puṣṭi, [6] Medhā, [7] Kriyā, [8] Lajjā, [9] Buddhi, [10] Śānti, [11] Vapus, [12] Kīrti, [13] Siddhi, born to Ābhūti[?].

|5.0| Vigatarāga spoke:

|5.1| Please definitely teach me the truth of the Niyama-rules now.

|5.1| I have become curious about it, [because] it is like a speech on the nectar of immortality.

|5.1| burnt by the fire of Prakṛti, sprinkled by the water of knowledge,...?

|5.1| ?? no satisfaction in Dharma.

|5.1| Anarthayajña spoke:

|5.2| I shall teach you something else which is nice to hear, O great Brahmin:

|5.2| the particular parts of Niyama, of five times five types.

|5.2| It is the essence of Dharma, dear to Hari, Hara and the sages, O great Brahmin,

|5.2| the destruction of the impurity of the Kali age, known as liberation by death???

|5.3| Purity, sacrifice, penance, donation, study and the restraint of sexual desire,

|5.3| religious observances, fasting, silence, and bathing: these are the ten Niyamas.

|5.4| From among these, now I shall teach you about purity [first, then] the others.

|5.4| [1] Bodily purity, [2] [purity of] food, [3]...?, [4]...? , and the fifth, [5]...?

|5.5| He should not beat or tie or kill [the body].

|5.5| [This concerns] others' wives and property???? and is called bodily purity.

|5.6| The cleanliness of the ears, O great Brahmin, and of the anus, the loin, the mouth etc.

|5.6| The purity of the mouth [comes from] sipping water. [It is to be done] when eating, speaking,

|5.7| [after] the emission of urine and faeces, and [before] the worship of gods.

|5.7| The wise one should clean his anus and his loin with clay and water.

|5.8| One [portion] for the loin, five for the anus, and ten for one [the left] hand.

|5.8| [Then] seven is to be applied for both [hands] by him who wished cleanliness with clay.

|5.9| This is the purification for the householder, twice as much for the chaste one.

|5.9| Three times as much for the forest-dweller, four times as much for the ascetic.

|5.10| I shall teach you the purification of food. Listen, pay great attention.

|5.10| He should eat two units of food and drink one unit of water.

|5.11| In order to be able to practise breath-control, he should save the remaining fourth.

|5.11|

|5.17|

|5.17| In the books of Manu, in the Purāṇas, in Śaivism, and in the Bhāratasaṃhitā,

|5.18| the practice of purity is definitely expanded in full.

|5.18| Now you have asked me [? about it], and I taught it [to you] in a condensed form.

|11.0| The Goddess spoke:

|11.1| O Paraśreṣṭha, O Surottama! Is there another [form of] universal [everybody can do it accessible to all] sacrifice,

|11.1| which is free of pain, which is easy, and which does not require an abundance of materials, O Īśvara?

|11.2| For the benefit of mankind, teach me, O Suraśreṣṭha, how one obtains the fruits of [this] universal sacrifice, which [process] is praised even by the gods.

|11.2| Maheśvara spoke:

|11.3| I cannot see anything comparable to your compassion towards living beings, O Bhāminī.

|11.3| What else could I teach concerning which there is no compassion [in you towards living beings]?

|11.4| I heard [this] previously from Sadāśiva's mouth, O Varasundarī.

|11.4| Listen, O Goddess, I shall teach you the ultimate essence of Dharma.

|11.5| Immaterial sacrifice satisfies all desires.

|11.5| It is undecaying and imperishable, and it removes all sins.

|11.6| Material things cause many obstacles and much trouble,

|11.6| similarly to Indra's murder of the Brahmin [Viśvarūpa], which yielded fruits that were distributed [among trees, lands etc.].

|11.7| Material sacrifice can be purified by the five purifications, O Varānanā.

|11.7| If it is purified, then the fruits will also be pure. If it is not purified, there is no fruit.

|11.7| The Goddess spoke:

|11.8| I am not sure about the five purifications, O Suraśreṣṭha.

|11.8| Please teach [them to] me one by one, I want to hear [them] as [they] really [are].

|11.8| Rudra spoke:

|11.9| The first is the purification of the mind, then comes the purification of the substances.

|11.9| The third is the purification of the mantras. The next one is the purification of the ritual.

|11.9| The fifth is the purification of Sattva. The purification of the sacrifice is [thus] fivefold.

|11.10| The purification of the mind is [achived] by mentally creating what is not wrong.

|11.10| The purification of the substances is [achieved] by [using] substances that were not obtained by unlawful means.

|11.11| The purification of the mantras is [achived] by [properly] joining vowels to consonants.

|11.11| The purification of the ritual is [achived] by not altering the proper sequence.

|11.11| The purification of Sattva is [achived] by the non-prevalence of Rajas and Tamas.

|11.12| When he has purified the ritual (vidhi) thus and performs the sacrifice,

|11.12| he will obtain the fruits of the sacrifice, and will not experience birth and death [again].

|11.13| [Perhaps:] But he who performs immaterial sacrifice, O Varasundarī,
